WAY4™ Release Notes (version 03.43.31)

This document contains an overview of the most significant changes in the new WAY4™ release and an appendix listing all fixes and enhancements.

Release Highlights

Major Modifications and Enhancements in WAY4™ version 03.43.31.

See the full list of modifications in sections: [Grouped by Products] and [Grouped by Releases].

See upgrade notes on Impact changes in section: [Upgrade Notes on Impact changes].

MasterCard interface

CARDS-49236

I1510156268

Now when calculating IRD, the relation of the POS terminal's time zone and the time the file with transaction information was exported to the payment system is considered.

CARDS-48493

Added support of issuer-provided instalments for MasterCard cardholders at POS terminals.

Core

CARDS-47813

Additional setup possibilities have been added to support calculation of multi-component merchant charges and partner (agent) commissions, for business models when the merchant communicates with the acquirer via a partner.
This new feature allows flexible setup of merchant pricing and sharing of fee income with the partner, including the ability to differentiate revenue shared with the partner depending on the profitability of a chosen set of components.

Updated Manuals: [tags description] [product_management\Service_Packages.pdf]

CARDS-48062

A new approach for Product tariff domain hierarchy configuration has been supported: the ability to attach specific tariff domains that represent a tariff plan (list of numeric parameters for client card service) using a contract parameter. This makes it possible to simplify the procedure for changing a Product or contract's tariff domain.

Updated Manuals: [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf]

Transaction management

CARDS-48414

Implemented new technology for creating transaction conditions based on transaction attributes.
These changes may impact the behaviour of usage limiters configured earlier, for Services based on transaction conditions that are not group conditions (whose code does not start with "G").

Issuing authorisation

CARDS-47796

Added support of PVV updates for MasterCard in PIN change and PIN set transactions and plastic reissuing.

CARDS-49055

Supported integration with MDES Issuing to work with various Token Service Providers (Apple Pay, Samsung Pay).

Case management

CARDS-47667

Supported a new tag, "REFRESH_CASE;" to configure activities in the ProgramCode field. The tag causes a case to be refreshed - parameters recalculated, parameter map updated - after an activity.

Updated Manuals: [case_management\Case_Management_Configuration.pdf]

CARDS-48948

Added the global parameter CM_HSK_KEEP regulating a document's HSK_KEEP tag. This tag is automatically set for all documents related to open cases and protects a document and related accounting entries from deletion during Housekeeping. 
Earlier, when closing a case, the HSK_KEEP tag was removed from documents. 
Now when the value of the global parameter CM_HSK_KEEP is "Y", the HSK_KEEP tag is not removed from documents when closing a case.

Updated Manuals: [case_management\Case_Management_Configuration.pdf]

Fleet cards

CARDS-47278

The cost of an item is calculated with consideration of discounts for different financial institutions participating in the transaction. Calculated values are created as additional information for a financial document and are used for settlements between financial institutions.

Acquiring authorisation

CARDS-47214

Implemented the following mechanism for processing transactions depending on the state of a POS terminal contract: 
•	A mandatory condition for processing payment terminal transactions in  WAY4 is that the corresponding device contract is in the "Ready" state, regardless of the parent contract's state. If the payment terminal contract remained in the "Not Ready" state after "Approve", all attempts to make transactions on this device will be rejected. 
•	For "virtual" terminals (used in WAY4 to interpret transactions made through self-service channels) transactions can be made for a device contract in the "Not Ready" state if this state is not related to a change in the Service Package, Accounting Scheme, or contract currency.

CARDS-48622

Supported "Send-to-Friend" transfers. 
"Send-to-Friend" allows a client to transfer money without specifying the requisites of the recipient or his bank. A transfer is made in two steps: 
1.	When the sender confirms the transfer, the debit part of the transaction is made and a unique URL link is generated. The link is sent to the recipient's contact information specified by the sender (phone number, e-mail address, messenger contact). 
2.	When the addressee gets the URL link, he goes to the bank's https page or self-service channel where he is prompted to select an option for getting the money: as a payment to a mobile phone account or a P2P transfer to any bank's card. After the payment method has been selected, the credit part of the transaction is made or the funds are transferred to the mobile operator.

CARDS-48160

Implemented a new mechanism for Original Credit Transaction (OCT, VISA P2P) based on VISA BIN Table data. When the VISA BIN Table is loaded, the BIN_DETAILS field is filled in with the RESTRICT_PAYM tag (instead of the PAYMENT tag). The tag value is a list of Business Application Identifiers (BAI) for which OCT is prohibited. If the RESTRICT_PAYM tag value is  "ALL" – all OCT for this BIN are prohibited (compatibility with the PAYMENT="N" tag is preserved). When the RESTRICT_PAYM is absent, all  OCT for this BIN are permitted.

Acquiring

CARDS-45312

FX Rate markup and merchant settlement currency redefinition has been implemented in back office side. This feature is used in multi-currency acquiring Products to support an acquirer conversion margin over bank internal or external FX rates and redefine the settlement (accounting) currency if it differs from the merchant pricing (transaction currency). The FX Rate markup is implicit (is hidden in the resulting FX rate applied to an acquiring transaction). It is configured flexibly using the Tariff Management module.

UnionPay interface

CARDS-47475

Clearing and settlement message codes have been revised and new codes have been added in accordance with the requirements of UnionPay International. Setup is required. Contact Support for details.

Money transfers

CARDS-48036

Supported "MIR" cardholder P2P transfers to other IPS.

Host2Host interface

CARDS-51531

I1509142952

IC Documents Export, IC Documents Import. The "EXCLUDE_TAGS" parameter has been added to the IC Documents Export, IC Documents Import pipes, making it possible to exclude export/import of the specified tags from/to doc.add_info. Parameter format is EXCLUDE_TAGS = <TagName1>,<TagName2>,...

Support of International Payment System Releases

WAY4 03.43.31.30 supports the requirements of payment system releases. Documents for configuring WAY4™ to comply with payment system requirements will be available no later than one month before the corresponding payment system begins operation according to the new requirements.

Upgrade Notes on Impact changes

Attention, these changes may affect your data, please read carefully!

Accounting

CARDS-41642 / I210188470

Trace has been added to the account renumeration precedure OpenWay\Full\DB Administrator Utilities\Special Contract Utilities\Renumber Subsidiary GL Account
The "Account Status" field has been removed from the "Account Types" form. If custom code used this field, it should be switched to another field, for example, "Category".

CARDS-52827

Trace has been added to the account renumeration precedure OpenWay\Full\DB Administrator Utilities\Special Contract Utilities\Renumber Subsidiary GL Account
Upgrade Note:
The algorithm for due date calculation in customer reports has been changed to support Date Schemes. The new behaviour may differ from previous behaviour when the due date is a non-working day. In this case explicit configuration of functional date shifts will be needed - see the manual <OW_HOME>\manuals\english\Product_management\Functional_Dates.pdf

Acquiring

CARDS-48971

Fixed incorrect format modifier processing for %DOC_TAG:...*<format>% variables.
Upgrade Note:
The algorithm for calculating columns 4-9 and 11 of the XLS_CB_f250_2.rdf report (this report is only for Russia) has been corrected. 
Accordingly, if the following parameters were specified in the menu item: P_CAN_DISPENSE_CASH, P_CAN_RETAIL, P_CAN_ACCEPT_CASH, P_CAN_WORK_WO_CARD, P_HAS_CARDREADER, these parameters must be reconfigured after consulting with Customer Support.

Application management

CARDS-49552

XML Applications Response pipe now property exports details of error that occurred during application import. Wrong application status could previously be reported for application R1 when SHORT_DEFERRED_RESPONSE parameter was disabled.
Upgrade Note:
For Advanced Applications R2 in a Secondary node, a request to accept unapproved applications is replaced with their approval.
In NoWF mode, in this case when an application has been approved successfully, the warning "Application is approved successfully and will be processed later" is returned. To handle this situation when working according to Workflow, the following setup in the strategy must be used:
- a record with the code 2265 must be added to OpenWay\Advanced Applications R2\Setup\Workflow Configuration\OpenWay Settings\Activity Results (error code that this type of application cannot be processed in a Secondary node).
- register this result for the action Accept - OpenWay\Advanced Applications R2\Setup\Workflow Configuration\Activities.
- Add a rule to Rules, that in the event of Accept with this result, the Approve action must be performed.

As a result, an attempt to accept an application that was completed with the code 2265 is replaced with its approval and the warning "Application is approved successfully and will be processed later" will be returned to the application's sender. This warning will be saved in the application's history.
After these applications are replicated to the Primary node, they will be processed by the nearest group accept (OpenWay\Advanced Applications R2\Application Processing\Issuing Applications - Accept, Acquiring Applications - Accept).
Setup has been added to the standard configuration and exported to \WAY4Source\WAY4Cards\Opt\applications_r2\db\datam\StandardWFStrategies.txt.

UFX-236

XML Applications Response pipe now property exports details of error that occurred during application import. Wrong application status could previously be reported for application R1 when SHORT_DEFERRED_RESPONSE parameter was disabled.
Upgrade Note:
Changed the default behaviour of the XML Advanced Applications Import (R2) pipe when the INPUT_FORMAT parameter is not specified. Now the pipe assumes UFX (FileHeader/FormatVersion='2.0') input format and immediately rejects all files that are not valid against the UFX schema. 
For backward compatibility the pipe also supports legacy Application format (FileHeader/FormatVersion='1.0'). This can be enabled by setting the parameter INPUT_FORMAT=Application.

Automated routines

CARDS-49298

The Approve procedure can be be called for sub-products. If the main product is not ready, Approve will be executed for the entire hierarchy; if the main product is ready, only the sub-product will be approved.
A new form has been added, OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Products\Product Definition\Products (No Hierarchy), for viewing all products without hierarchy.
Upgrade Note:
Changed the algorithm for calculating the date an annual miscellaneous Service fee is generated/charged. 
The error appeared in system settings: 
- recurring fee type ("Full/Configuration Setup/Transaction Types/Fee Types") has the parameter value Charge Event="Yearly". 
- Service in the Fee Day field contains a value other than -12, 0, 12, 
and only on the following conditions: 
- the number of days in the month in which the contract is registered is less than the number of days in the month in which the fee will be charged.
- the contract's opening date is later than the 28th day of the month. 

WAY4 Support provides separate test scripts that should be run on a copy of the production system before starting the procedure for upgrading to the new version. 
If the test script discovers the aforementioned settings in the system, contact Support for additional recommendations.

Case management

CARDS-48522

The Case Management screen with case details has been optimized to decrease "Contract" tab opening time.
Upgrade Note:
The following changes have been made in menu items:
- The "Operations" item has been removed from ROOT\OpenWay\Case Management and ROOT\OpenWay\Case Management\Configuration Setup\General Configuration\Amount Types has been added with the ability to configure amount types for different domain categories.
- The "OpenWay Settings" and "Configuration Setup" items have been removed from ROOT\OpenWay\CM Consumer Collections.
- The "OpenWay Settings", "Configuration Setup" and "Automated Routines" items have been removed from ROOT\OpenWay\Dispute Assistant CM.
- The ROOT\OpenWay\СМ Risk Management menu for working with financial cases has been added.
- The ROOT\OpenWay\CM Card Blocking menu for working with domain category "B" cases has been added.
These changes must be considered when configuring user privileges.

CARDS-49169

The Case Management screen with case details has been optimized to decrease "Contract" tab opening time.
Upgrade Note:
The CODE field has been added for domains (CM_DOMAIN table). By default, this field is NOT filled in. It must be filled in manually (ROOT\OpenWay\Case Management\Configuration Setup\General Configuration\Case Domains) for domains that are used. The value must be unique in the domain category. The value is verified during "Approve" for a domain.

Core

CARDS-47549

Problem when some GL Entries could be created with a GL Date in the past has been fixed. See Upgrade Notes for more details.
Upgrade Note:
Due to changes in processing standing payment orders in version 03.41.30 as per CARDS-44639, an additional validation script has been added to the Upgrade Wizard. If the Upgrade Wizard finds duplicate or empty Order Codes in template payment orders in any Accounting Scheme (except Bank Accounting Schemes), upgrade will be stopped until all errors have been fixed, or until the user manually selects the "ignore this error class" option. To avoid widespread errors during upgrade, a special menu item, "Check Template Orders", is provided by OpenWay Support. This item should be run before upgrading. All errors found at this stage must be eliminated before or during upgrade.

CARDS-47813

Problem when some GL Entries could be created with a GL Date in the past has been fixed. See Upgrade Notes for more details.
Upgrade Note:
Added the ability to set the order in which custom fees are processed for a Service by using priorities specified in the "Priority" field of the "Custom Fee" form. Fees are processed in descending order of priority. Custom fees with a priority of "0" are processed last in random order.

Earlier the system did not guarantee any specific order for processing custom fees as it was assumed that all custom fees are independent and can be processed separately. However in some configurations, a stable fee processing sequence could be observed due to Oracle in-build logic. If Service configuration relied on a certain "usual", unguaranteed order for processing custom fees, it must be explicitly established using priorities since after upgrade to the new version this "usual" order will be arbitrarily changed and may lead to errors in calculation.

If a customised "Separate fees for own and credit funds" solution is used (OPT_FEE custom package provided by OpenWay), it is also necessary to fill in the "Priority" field in the "Custom Fee" form. Priority should be set in case when one transaction service has two custom fees: for spending own funds and for spending credit funds. Custom Fee for spending credit funds should have higher priority than custom fee for spending own funds. If priority is missing, the fee amount may be calculated incorrectly. 
If custom fees are set up independently and no sequence for processing them is expected, it is not necessary to change anything.

CARDS-48391

Problem when some GL Entries could be created with a GL Date in the past has been fixed. See Upgrade Notes for more details.
Upgrade Note:
Balance Types configuration has been refactored significantly.
The following changes have been made:
1. The By Billing field, which previously had the values Yes/No (balance_type.by_billing) has been deleted from the standard form OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Accounting Setup\Balance Types. In the upgrade process, the following changes take place: this field is cleared. If it contained the "Yes" value, "b" -"Billing (After closing)" is set in a new field, "History Mode" ( balance_type.history_mode).
2. The "History Mode" (balance_type.history_mode field) has been added to the form. This field is filled in automatically from the "HISTORY_MODE" tag during upgrade. The "B" value appears as "Billing (Before closing)", differently from the previous by_billing = 'Y' which appears as "Billing (After closing)". The "latest items only (SRV)" value has been removed from the list of possible values and instead, a new tag, "SAVE_LATEST" will automatically be set during validation. This tag indicates that information about the last four transactions will be used for calculating and showing turnover/balance. If the "History Mode" field is not filled in, history is not saved.  
3. A balance type validation procedure has been added. It is run during upgrade and also by clicking the button [Do] -> [Validate all balances] in the form OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Accounting Setup\Balance Types.
4. A new information tag, "USAGE" has been added. This tag is filled in during validation of the balance type configuration. Possible values of this tag are: 
"UNUSED" - this balance type is not used in any configuration
"SERV_TURNOVER" - this balance type is used in a Service configuration
"ACC_TURNOVER" - this balance type is used in an account template configuration and has a Direction (i.e. it accumulates account turnover)
"BALANCE" - this balance type is used in an account template configuration and does not have a Direction (i.e. it stores account balances)
"HARDCODED" - this balance type has a predefined code and predefined processing
"HAS_SUBS" - this balance type aggregates other balance types, i.e. it has subordinate balance types.

A correct configuration is one in which each balance type has only one use and the "USAGE" tag contains only one value. If this is not so, the tag "USAGE" will contain a list of all values found during the usage validation process, separated by commas, for example  USAGE=SERV_TURNOVER,BALANCE;. These configurations cause a validation error and must be  corrected.  
5. Upgrade of balance type configuration and the validation process are automatically called during the system upgrade process. Results are logged in the Process Log under the process name "Validate balance types". 
If validation failed, the error correction step can be skipped (by clicking the [Skip] button) and the installation process continued. However, all errors must be eliminated after upgrade has been completed.
6. The screen form OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Accounting Setup\Balance Types has been updated - the "By Billing" field has been removed and a new field, "History Mode" added. In addition, the button [Do..] -> [Validate all balance types] has been added.

CARDS-48629

Problem when some GL Entries could be created with a GL Date in the past has been fixed. See Upgrade Notes for more details.
Upgrade Note:
The global variable glob.UseMonthWeight has been deleted, if it was used in custom code, it should be replaced with the financial institution parameter
contract_parm.GET_FI_PARM(<Required FI ID>, 'USE_MONTH_WEIGHT', stnd.Yes, TraceOn);.

CARDS-48863

Problem when some GL Entries could be created with a GL Date in the past has been fixed. See Upgrade Notes for more details.
Upgrade Note:
The "SET_THROUGH" parameter (tag) in classifier values is no longer supported and is not processed in WAY4 (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Common Handbooks\User Classifiers – [Values] "AddInfo" field).
This tag may have been configured to set product options through an Event (for example, in file interfaces or via SOA) and simultaneously through the use of classifiers (for example, through WAY4Web Customer Service Workbench). Starting from this version, the tag is not required for these configurations. If it was used in complex product settings or custom settings, special instructions from Support are required.
WAY4 customer support provides a separate test script that should be run in a copy of the production system before starting the procedure for upgrading to the new version.
If the test script finds the "SET_THROUGH" parameter is used in system settings, contact Support for additional instructions.

CARDS-49220

Problem when some GL Entries could be created with a GL Date in the past has been fixed. See Upgrade Notes for more details.
Upgrade Note:
The CS_DEC_CURR_LOG index for the CS_DECISION_LOG table and CS_STATUS_TYPE_VALUE index for the CS_STATUS_LOG table have been deleted. It is necessary to review custom procedures where these indexes are used to search for contracts/clients with a certain classifier value or decision value for a specific date.

CARDS-49227

Problem when some GL Entries could be created with a GL Date in the past has been fixed. See Upgrade Notes for more details.
Upgrade Note:
Reports are now shown differently in Process Log. In earlier versions each time a report was run, a record in Process Log was created with Process Name = "Report" and Parameters = name of the menu item, running this report. Now the Parameters field will contain tags: the TITLE tag with the name of the menu item and the REPORT tag with the first 30 characters of the report name (hardcoded in an rdf file). This may impact custom data extracts from WAY4 Process Log to external monitoring systems.

CARDS-49714

Problem when some GL Entries could be created with a GL Date in the past has been fixed. See Upgrade Notes for more details.
Upgrade Note:
The "BT_SIMPLE" method for calculating minimum payment has changed, and changes in the configuration may be required. The Min Repayment value that can be set using Statement Tariff or in an Account Scheme, is no longer used as the value of the Full Statement Balance Threshold parameter. In the new system behaviour (if the value of Repayment Percent is not equal to zero), if the current minimum due amount is less than the Min Repayment value, the current minimum amount will be increased to the Min Repayment value. A new Threshold tariff with the code "MTP_FULL_BALANCE" must be used as the Full Statement Balance Threshold parameter.

CARDS-50723

Problem when some GL Entries could be created with a GL Date in the past has been fixed. See Upgrade Notes for more details.
Upgrade Note:
Additional input parameters have been added to the CUST_TRANS_CODE custom function. If you have this function redefined in your installation it should be updated. You will received updated customizations delivery from OW Support as part of migration process.

CARDS-51895

Problem when some GL Entries could be created with a GL Date in the past has been fixed. See Upgrade Notes for more details.
Upgrade Note:
A new field, "Step N", has been added to the Event setup form "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Products\Event Types -> [Event Chain]". The order for loading and posting Events in chains is set in this field. All Event chains should be checked and the appropriate order should be specified in this field. If the "Step N" field is not filled, the parent Event is loaded first and then all chain Events in the order in which they appear in the chain.
If loading of chain Events depends on the parent Event or previous Events in a chain, the DEPENDENT_CHAIN tag should be set in the "Special Parameters" field of the Event on which loading of other Events depends.

CARDS-47912

Problem when some GL Entries could be created with a GL Date in the past has been fixed. See Upgrade Notes for more details.
Upgrade Note:
A number of issues have been fixed in the "Contract Parameters" form (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Common Handbooks\Contract Parameters).
If this form has been used to set up any functionality, these settings should be validated by clicking the [Check All] button in the form.

CARDS-49144

Problem when some GL Entries could be created with a GL Date in the past has been fixed. See Upgrade Notes for more details.
Upgrade Note:
Default values have been corrected for the following parameters of the XLS_NSPK_Statistics_Issuing_Business_Prepared.rdf report:  P_TRANS_FILTER, P_IS_TRANSFER_CREDIT_FLT, P_IS_TRANSFER_DEBIT_FLT.
Errors in the procedure for synchronising parameter values have also been corrected. Therefore, to synchronise parameter values, run the menu item "OpenWay\NSPK\NSPK. Reports\Report Parameters Configuration(NSPK Issuing)".

CARDS-49252

Problem when some GL Entries could be created with a GL Date in the past has been fixed. See Upgrade Notes for more details.
Upgrade Note:
Changed the algorithm for calculating the number of transactions made through a Balance Type using the COUNTER_ONLY tag (in the "Posting details" field) for cases when accounts in different currencies are registered for the contract. To do so, a new technical currency has been implemented for recording the number of transactions.
Now "COUNTER_ONLY" Balance Type are recorded in the "NUM" technical currency, not in the contract currency and a letter code, not a number code is specified in the "Currency" field (for access to information about a contract's Balance Type values, click the [Additional] button in the "Balance for <…>" window of the corresponding contract.)
The logic for recording "COUNTER_ONLY" balances has also changed , now Advices are considered "positive" and Reversals as "negative". This change affects Balance Types with Direction=Debit / Debit Entry / None, whose sign will change to the opposite after system upgrade.
For example:
3 Retail transactions; 2 Reversals; 1 Credit transaction
- for a Balance Type with Direction=Debit, the balance value will be equal to 1 (+3 – 2)
- for a Balance Type with Direction=Debit Entry, the balance value will be equal to 3 (+3)
- for a Balance Type with Direction=none, the balance value will be equal to 2 (+3 – 2 +1).
These changes impact how data are shown in standard screen forms and in SOA messages that contain contract balance data. Custom export of contract balance data may also be affected. Standard batch export interfaces are not affected by this change since they do not export data from contract balance tables.
WAY4 customer support provides a separate test script that should be run in a copy of the production system before starting the procedure for upgrading to the new version.
If the test script finds the COUNTER_ONLY parameter is used in system settings, contact Support for additional instructions.

CARDS-49392

Problem when some GL Entries could be created with a GL Date in the past has been fixed. See Upgrade Notes for more details.
Upgrade Note:
The "SAVE_GL_N" parameter in Accounting Scheme templates is no longer supported and is not processed in WAY4 (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Products\Issuing Private Products\Private Issuing Account Schemes – [Details] – "Special Parms" field). 
This means that if the "SAVE_GL_N" tag is set in a child Accounting Scheme, it is deleted from this scheme when the Accounting Scheme (parent or child) is approved. 
System default behaviour is now as follows: "GL Number" and "HeadOffice GL Number" are not copied from the Parent Scheme only when these fields are already filled in the Child Scheme. 
Therefore:
- when "GL Number" / "HeadOffice GL Number" are not filled in a Child Scheme, values are inherited from the Parent Scheme on first approval.
- when "GL Number" / "HeadOffice GL Number" change in a Child Scheme, the next time this scheme is approved, its own values are saved (not inherited from the Parent Scheme a second time).
- when "GL Number" / "HeadOffice GL Number" change in the Parent Scheme, values are not inherited by a Child Scheme.
- if the account template's "GL Number" / "HeadOffice GL Number" field is empty when reapproving a Child Scheme, values are inherited from the Parent Scheme.
WAY4 customer support provides a separate test script that should be run in a copy of the production system before starting the procedure for upgrading to the new version.
If the test script finds the "SAVE_GL_N" is used in system settings, contact Support for additional instructions.

CARDS-50034

Problem when some GL Entries could be created with a GL Date in the past has been fixed. See Upgrade Notes for more details.
Upgrade Note:
If a custom menu item is used for Evening End of Day, the menu subitem SAVE_NEW_LDATE must be added after entering a new banking date, even if Distributed Processing is not used. See OpenWay\Full\DB Administrator Utilities\Special OpenWay Utilities\2-phased Set Banking Date\Set Banking Date (2-phased) for an example.

CARDS-53809

Problem when some GL Entries could be created with a GL Date in the past has been fixed. See Upgrade Notes for more details.
Upgrade Note:
A check and reconfiguration must be performed by clients using the TOTAL_BAL_TYPE tag in Service or tariff configurations .
If the tag is used for the configuration of prepaid cards with the TOTAL_BAL_TYPE=AVAILABLE; value, the additional tag TOTAL_BAL_TYPE_SIGN=+; must be added.
If this tag is used with another balance type, or for configuration of other Product types (not prepaid cards), contact Customer Support.

CARDS-47937 / I1602255603

Problem when some GL Entries could be created with a GL Date in the past has been fixed. See Upgrade Notes for more details.
Macrotransaction "Source Amount" field filling has been changed. Previously for transactions with FX conversion, this field may have been equal to zero, now for all such cases the zero value is overridden by the amount of the entry posted to the source account.
This may affect the "IC Doc Export" pipe which exports a macrotransaction's "Source Amount" field in the "SrcTrn" tag of the <Extra> XML element. Previously for transactions with FX conversion, this tag may have contained zero and will now contain the transaction amount in the Source Account currency.

CARDS-52967 / I1704121197

Problem when some GL Entries could be created with a GL Date in the past has been fixed. See Upgrade Notes for more details.
The algorithm for calculating the date of generating/charging an annual miscellaneous Service fee has changed.
The error appeared in system settings:
- recurring fee type ("Full/Configuration Setup/Transaction Types/Fee Types") has the parameter value Charge Event="Yearly".
- the Service or tariff used by the Service in the Fee Day field contains a value other than -12, 0, 12,
and only on the condition that the base date for calculating the annual fee is equal to 28 February of any year that is not a leap year.
By default, the base date for calculating the fee is the contract's opening date. The base date can be redefined by the BASE_DATE tag in the transaction subtype's Fee Algorithm field.

WAY4 Customer Support provides separate test scripts that should be run in a copy of the production system before starting upgrade to a new version.
If the test scripts discover the aforementioned settings in WAY4, please contact Customer Support for further instructions.

CARDS-37268 / I310186397

Problem when some GL Entries could be created with a GL Date in the past has been fixed. See Upgrade Notes for more details.
Fixed problem when some GL Entries were created with GL Date in the past. These entries could occur when posting fees, processing standing payment orders or posting Interest according to Events. Now if an Event is posted during the "Contracts Daily Update" procedure, a check is made that the GL Date is after or equal to the previous banking date. If the date is earlier, it will be overridden as the current banking date.
If an Event is posted at any other time (not in the "Contracts Daily Update" procedure), the GL Date is always set as the current banking date.
The previous behaviour was incorrect - these entries could not be exported by standard pipes.
Product Inspector test scripts may be impacted if standard scripts were saved with the wrong GL dates.

CARDS-51495

Problem when some GL Entries could be created with a GL Date in the past has been fixed. See Upgrade Notes for more details.
Upgrade Note:
Change in the logic of Reports XLS_CB_f250_1.rdf, XLS_CB_f250_2.rdf, XLS_CB_f250_3.rdf: the "SHOW_IN_250" tag will be automatically deleted from the "Add Info" field of the "DWD_CARD_CATEGORY" classifier in the "DWH_CONF" configuration group (OpenWay\WAY4 Datamart Interface\Configuration Groups).

Customer/account management

CARDS-47231

Increased the precision of reading FX rates for macrotransactions to 12 digits for use in screen forms and reports.
Upgrade Note:
An additional check has been added to the procedure for checking a standing payment order to ensure the direction of the payment order has been correctly specified, depending on the Party Type: Payer or Payee.
The following combinations are considered correct: 
1. For external credit transfers:
For Order type=Debit Amount (i.e. Trans Type direction=Credit) the counterparty for the operation is the Payee.
2. For external debit transfers:
For Order type=Credit Amount (i.e. TransType direction=Debit) the counterparty for the operation is the Payer.
If these conditions are not met, after the standing payment order has been checked, the corresponding error message will be output.
Incorrect settings also affect subsequent execution of the Approve procedure.

CARDS-48768

Increased the precision of reading FX rates for macrotransactions to 12 digits for use in screen forms and reports.
Upgrade Note:
Accounting contracts can no longer be deleted directly in forms (Issuing Contracts (Private), Issuing Contracts (Corporate), Acquiring Contracts, Bank Accounting Contracts). To delete these contracts, use the menu items OpenWay\Full\DB Administrator Utilities\Special Contract Utilities\Issuing Contracts - Remove and OpenWay\Full\DB Administrator Utilities\Special Contract Utilities\Acquiring Contracts Remove.

CARDS-48252

Increased the precision of reading FX rates for macrotransactions to 12 digits for use in screen forms and reports.
Upgrade Note:
Clients can no be longer deleted directly in the "Clients (Private)" and "Clients (Corporate)" forms. To delete these clients, the menu items "OpenWay\Full\DB Administrator Utilities\Special Contract Utilities\Private Clients Remove" and "OpenWay\Full\DB Administrator Utilities\Special Contract Utilities\Corporate Clients Remove" should be used.

CARDS-48032 / I1603048816

Increased the precision of reading FX rates for macrotransactions to 12 digits for use in screen forms and reports.
Resulting from changes to automatic calculation of values for standard Product classifiers (such as  CONTR_SUBTYPE and PRODUCT_GROUP), the time to execute the "Apply product changes" procedure in the first CDU after upgrade may increase. This is due to additional checks for contracts with an empty acnt_contract.main_product value. It is recommended to execute the "Apply product changes" procedure once after upgrade to decrease the time it takes to execute the daily opening procedure.

DB kernel

DBK-1927

For event messages (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Products\Event Types, "Messages" button) the filter in the "Dictionary" button has been changed so that only linked records are shown in the "Dictionary for Messages for..."form.
Upgrade Note:
To optimize storage of process_mess and evnt_msg tables in case of using composite partitioning for these tables, two new tablespaces OWPART_D and OWPART_I have been introduced. In case of new WAY4 schema installation or redefinition of process_mess and evnt_msg tables the new tablespaces OWPART_D and OWPART_I have to be created and presented in the [Replacing] section of OWS_WORK\db.ini file.The tablespace storage parameters can be provided by Customer Support upon request. 
If the composite partitioning is not supposed to be used instead of creating the new tablespaces they can be mapped to OWLARGE_D and OWLARGE_I respectively in the [Replacing] section of OWS_WORK\db.ini file:
OWPART_D=OWLARGE_D
OWPART_I=OWLARGE_I

DBK-1978

For event messages (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Products\Event Types, "Messages" button) the filter in the "Dictionary" button has been changed so that only linked records are shown in the "Dictionary for Messages for..."form.
Upgrade Note:
WAY4 Schema Checksum Report now considers the order of columns in indexes and shows the difference for indexes whose column order differs from the standard configuration. I.e. if column order differs from the standard configuration, the report will differ from the previous one, and this should be considered in system upgrade. If new discrepancies in checksums are discovered, contact WAY4 support for additional recommendations.

DB manager

DBK-1833

Report Engine R2 batch mode. The engine incorrectly substituted SELECT columns into parameters if the substitutions were marked by sequence numbers (%1%, %2%, ...).
Upgrade Note:
.Net ver 4.5 and higher is needed on workstations to work with Product Inspector in DB Manager.

Datamart

DBK-1758

Datamart Upgrade Wizard has been enhanced. The "Attach Datamart" action has been removed. The action is only available in the DM console.
Upgrade Note:
The "Attach Datamart" action has been removed from the Upgrade Wizard. Use DM console to attach Datamart.

Diners Club interface

CARDS-50949

DCI DXS Outward: AQGEO field processing.
Upgrade Note:
Manual change is required for DCI channel message. Code "S1-I-", trans type "Interchange Total" must be changed to code "S1-AI-", trans type "Acq Interchange Total". Code "S1F-", trans type "Reimbursement Fee Total" must be changed to code "S1-AF--", trans type "Acq Reimbursement Fee Total". Changes should be made when starting to use the new version of the pipe. If changes are not made, settlement documents will not be posted (unknown message code error).

Dispute assistant

CARDS-50154 / I1607269017

DA v2: Supported OnUs disputes.
Dispute Assistant R2 (acquiring): Reversal documents that were not created in the DA interface are supported. To apply this functionality, an activity with idt DSP_ACPT_PRS_REV_SYSACT should be registered in the acquirer strategy in the "Processing chargeback" step or according to client dispute workflow. Since the "Accepted Presentment Reversal (Iss)" activity is now supported on both sides (issuer and acquirer), it is recommended to rename it to "Accepted Presentment Reversal".

High availability

DBK-2235

Incorrect PostingStatus values are no longer assigned to documents moved from a secondary HA node when deferred processing takes these records in a different order than the original one.
Upgrade Note:
How to upgrade from 42.30 to 43.30:

1. Start upgrade on Primary/Prod.
2. Install upgrade on Primary/Prod.
3. Complete upgrade on Prod.
4. Make sure all transactions made on Secondary/StandIn are successfully synced to Primary/Prod.
5. Detach Secondary/StandIn.
6. Connect to DB Manager/WAY4 Manager on Primary/Prod using OWS Home 43.30.
7. Save information about the database link connection string into the database:
   1. Menu Item "OpenWay -> Synchronising Systems -> Configuration Setup -> System Instances", then click on the "Connections" button.
   2. Create a connection string row for every instance in Synchronising Systems. 
   3. By default this is a global database name. It can be replaced with an Oracle TNS connection string. For instance:
      (DESCRIPTION=(ADDRESS_LIST =(ADDRESS = (PROTOCOL = TCP)(HOST = HATEST7)(PORT = 1521)))(CONNECT_DATA = (SID = db1)(SERVER = DEDICATED)))
8. Go back to DB Replication console.
9. Attach Secondary/StandIn.

Operation:

1. Use the menu item "Recreate database link" in DB Replication Console if it is necessary to change the database link password in the proper node.
2. Use DB Manager/WAY4 Manager in Prod and then the menu item "Recreate database link" in DB Replication Console if it is necessary to change the database link connection string.

Instalment management

CARDS-48525

Instalment Payment holidays portion amount calculation has been corrected for the "Keep Tenor" option.
Upgrade Note:
Behaviour when calculating a new instalment plan for payment holidays has changed. The previous system behaviour used an Invoice Event with the "Change Instalment Terms" action since invoices for the unpaid principal amount didn't change their statuses. The new behaviour allows deferral of payment including for instalments that are open or overdue at the time payment holidays are granted. 

If payment holidays are used, it is necessary to additionally set up Invoice Events in the menu item OpenWay\Instalments\Instalment Configuration\Instalment Events and Fees\Invoice Events with a new Action = "Payment Holidays": for the Amount Type = Principal: 
Status Before=OVD, Status After=Revised with a standing payment order to transfer funds from the "overdue principal" account to the "waiting principal" account. 
Status Before=Open, Status After=Revised with a standing payment order to transfer funds from the "open principal" account to the "waiting principal" account.
Status Before=PaidPart, Status After=Revised with a standing payment order to transfer funds from the "open principal" account to the "waiting principal" account. 

Invoice Events for the Amount Type=Fee must be copied from the Invoice Events with the Actions "Revise" and "Change Instalment Terms" actions.

CARDS-49906

Instalment Payment holidays portion amount calculation has been corrected for the "Keep Tenor" option.
Upgrade Note:
Signature of trf.INSTL_FEE_PARMS and trf.INSTL_PARMS has been extended to include document records as input parameters. Custom procedures using these procedures should be corrected.

CARDS-48077

Instalment Payment holidays portion amount calculation has been corrected for the "Keep Tenor" option.
Upgrade Note:
Numeric values for Instalment Limits with the "Active Plans Count" calculation type are now stored in tariffs with the "Technical" role instead of the "Threshold" role. The appropriate tariff type must be set up. Verification that the proper tariff exists has been added to validation of Instalment Limit type setup. When manually entering a tariff value, specify the number of active plans in the "Counter" field. 

To set the maximum and minimum number of active plans, set up additional tariffs whose codes are specified in the format <tariff type code corresponding to the code of the record in the "Instalment Limit Types" form_MIN>, <tariff type code corresponding to the code of the record in the "Instalment Limit Types" form_MIN> also with the "Technical role.

CARDS-51965

Instalment Payment holidays portion amount calculation has been corrected for the "Keep Tenor" option.
Upgrade Note:
Changed the procedure for generating fee invoice records for instalment plan fees when the fee percentage or amount is passed in document tags. Earlier these records were created with the "FEE" debt code (this value corresponds to the Invoice Events - Fee Code setting). Now the debt code is taken from instalment scheme fee parameters depending on the Calc Scheme.
If an Instalment Scheme contains several fees with the same Calc Scheme, debt code will be taken from the first one. If no fees are configured in the Instalment Scheme, or debt code is not specified for the corresponding fee, the "FEE" value will be used as earlier.

CARDS-52686

Instalment Payment holidays portion amount calculation has been corrected for the "Keep Tenor" option.
Upgrade Note:
Forms to fill in instalment actions parameters have been changed to use the local_constants table instead of the appl_info table. 
If customized forms were used for instalment management they should be changed the same way.

CARDS-53919

Instalment Payment holidays portion amount calculation has been corrected for the "Keep Tenor" option.
Upgrade Note:
It is not recommended to use the same fee type for Instalment Event Fees and other Misc Fees as this may affect reversal processing. An upgrade script to check such cases is provided and problematic configurations should be changed manually.

Issuing

CARDS-49369

Fixed definition of IPS Product for MasterCard subtypes.
Upgrade Note:
MIR statistics reports -> NSPK-Issuing report:
Parameter default values have been changed. It is necessary to run the menu item "OpenWay\NSPK\NSPK. Reports\Report Parameters Configuration(NSPK Issuing)". In addition, the statistic attribute TRN_IS_TRANSFER must be added to "OpenWay\Full\Statistics\Dictionaries\Statistic Attributes (custom)". This can be done manually or by Copy Configuration.

Issuing authorisation

CARDS-51820 / I1612121917

Fixed "No Data Found" error during authorization processing if contr_subtype.bin_record is invalid.
The additional global parameter ENABLE_NO_CHECK is no longer supported. It is not possible to create new products/contract with Auth scenario=No Check (existing contracts with Auth Scenario=No Check will be processed as See Main).

JCB interface

CARDS-51481

JCB Interface fixed format (pipes): supported contactless PEM.
Upgrade Note:
JCB ISO Outward (variable): added the "EXT_CURR_EXP" parameter for changing the currency exponent on transaction export. Parameter format: EXT_CURR_EXP = <3_digit_currency><1_digit_exponent_to_be_used>. This parameter can be used if the currency exponent in WAY4 differs from the JCB currency exponent.
For example EXT_CURR_EXP = 7040 (use 0 exponent for VND currency).

CARDS-53336

JCB Interface fixed format (pipes): supported contactless PEM.
Upgrade Note:
If the new JCB ISO format is used, the following Message Types must be added (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Transaction Types\Message Types - All):
1.
Channel=JCB
Name=Rejected Item Fin
Code=RmP-----
Category=Advice
Is Authorization=Fin
Trans Type=Rejected Item Fin
2.
Channel=JCB
Name=Rejected Fixing
Code=RmR-----
Category=Advice
Is Authorization=Fin
Trans Type=Rejected Fixing
Msg Details=OUT_ST=C;
3.
Channel=JCB
Name=Rejected Item
Code=RjP-----
Category=Advice
Is Authorization=Fin
Trans Type=Rejected Item
4.
Channel=JCB
Name=Rejected File
Code=RJP-----
Category=Advice
Is Authorization=Fin
Trans Type=Rejected File

Loyalty

CARDS-51610

Added the ability to limit the bonus points amount accrued for a client contract within a loyalty campaign. The limit amount should be set in the "Action Total Limit" field of the tariff action, the ACTION_LIMIT_MODE=LOCAL tag indicates that the action limit should be calculated for each contract. A new strict mode has been added to check the action limit, it prevents total points from exceeding the specified limit with the last transaction; ACTION_LIMIT_MODE=STRICT should be set for the tariff action.
Upgrade Note:
Changed custom fee amount calculation on posting for services that use fee contract redefinition (CONTRACT_FOR tag) and a fee amount calculated using FEE_BASE_FROM=FROM_BALANCE or FEE_BASE_FROM=CUSTOM (the custom procedure CUST_FEE_BASE is used). New behaviour uses the redefined contract to calculate the balance and passes the redefined contract to the custom procedure. Old behaviour used the contract the service was defined in.
Such approach was always used on authorisation, the contract passed to calculate a custom fee amount was already redefined by CONTRACT_FOR tag. Now a unified approach is used for custom fee calculation on both authorisation and posting.
If configuration uses both CONTRACT_FOR and FEE_BASE_FROM=FROM_BALANCE or FEE_BASE_FROM=CUSTOM tags on one service, calculation will change, redefined contract will be used to calculate balance and passed to custom procedure. If previous behavior should be supported, contact support.

MasterCard interface

CARDS-48289

NSPK MPE Loading: fixed situation when not all issuer records for one MasterCard range are copied to NSPK BIN group.
Upgrade Note:
The XLS_MC_Statistics_Acquiring_Business.rdf report has been updated: MasterCard Debit Switch transactions are now supported in the report. For these changes to be applied in statistics, do the following 
1. Merge the new standard version of the cust_stat_attr_value procedure with the one used (if it was customized)
2. Drop statistics for the whole reporting period (run the menu items OpenWay\Full\Statistics\Drop Statistics and OpenWay\Full\Statistics\Dictionaries\Purge Obsolete Statistical Groups)
3. Install the XLS_MC_Statistics_Acquiring_Business.rdf report from this version according to doc\reportssetup.html manual.

CARDS-52360

NSPK MPE Loading: fixed situation when not all issuer records for one MasterCard range are copied to NSPK BIN group.
Upgrade Note:
To load old format files, set the pipe parameter LINE_LENGTH=500.

MasterCard MCBS Import: Supported new format according to Global Operations Bulletin No. 2 - 1 February 2017.

CARDS-53033

NSPK MPE Loading: fixed situation when not all issuer records for one MasterCard range are copied to NSPK BIN group.
Upgrade Note:
Acquirers in Asia Pacific region: Use Copy Configuration to synchronize MasterCard service packs from file \home\db\datax\config\MC_IRD_CFG_SP_CC.txt.

(MasterCard Services: Added services according to Release 17.Q3 article AN 1005)

CARDS-53040

NSPK MPE Loading: fixed situation when not all issuer records for one MasterCard range are copied to NSPK BIN group.
Upgrade Note:
Acquirers in Europe region that participate in the Meal Voucher program must use Copy Configuration to synchronize MasterCard service packs from file \home\db\datax\config\MC_IRD_CFG_SP_CC.txt.

(MasterCard Services: Added services according to Release 17.Q3 article AN 1004.)

CARDS-53808

NSPK MPE Loading: fixed situation when not all issuer records for one MasterCard range are copied to NSPK BIN group.
Upgrade Note:
"South Sudan" (code SSD) must be manually included in "MC: Middle East, Africa (E)" area.

NSPK interface

CARDS-48907

NSPK Processing (pipes) : fixed processing of PDS 2063.
Upgrade Note:
Quarterly statistics reports required in Russia by the Central Bank and NSPK are now split into two different menu items. Now the menu item OpenWay\NSPK\NSPK. Reports\Report Types shows only NSPK reports and OpenWay\RF Reporting\Report Types shows only the Form 250 Section 1 Russian Central Bank Report. This change only impacts customers in the Russian Federation with the RF Reporting and NSPK license filters.

CARDS-49206

NSPK Processing (pipes) : fixed processing of PDS 2063.
Upgrade Note:
To support the requirements of NSPK Operational bulletin #38.2015 of 29.12.2015 updated on 19.01.2016, it is necessary to do the following in the XLS_NSPK_Statistics_Acquiring_Business.rdf report (per the task CARDS-48998)
1. Load statistic attributes from the configuration file or add the TRN_IS_TRANSFER statistic attribute manually in the OpenWay\Full\Statistics\Dictionaries\Statistic Attributes (custom) form.
2. If WAY4Cards version 03.43.30 is used, install the new version of the cust_stat_attr_value package. The support of this attribute is provided in standard system packages starting from version 03.44.30.

Product inspector

CARDS-47660

Product Inspector test script import has been modified when in the file being imported there are test scripts with the same codes that already exist in the destination WAY4Cards system. In the first step of the import procedure, all the existing test steps in the database are marked with the new status "Obsolete" (earlier steps were deleted). In the second step, the system checks if the step exists in the file being imported. If not, the step in the database is kept with the "Obsolete" status, otherwise the step gets a status and inherits other parameters from the file being imported. When a Product Inspector script is run, a step with the "Obsolete" status behaves the same way as a step with the "Skip" status.
Upgrade Note:
Due to changes in inherited standing order processing in version 03.41.30 as per CARDS-44639, the Product Inspector "Activate Order" test step can no longer be used to activate a new inherited standing order. A new step "Create Order By Template" is supported for the first activation. The impact is on existing test scripts. All steps for first activation of inherited orders should be replaced with new step type. Sample test scripts may appear as follows:
 "Contract"  "Create Main"
 "For Contract" "Create Order By Template"  (a standing order will be created for the contract based on the template and activated)
For existing contracts with already existing but inactive standing orders the old test type can be used, for example:
"Contract" "Attach"
"For Contract" "Activate Order"  (existing but inactive standing order will be activated).

CARDS-51348 / I1611305656

Product Inspector test script import has been modified when in the file being imported there are test scripts with the same codes that already exist in the destination WAY4Cards system. In the first step of the import procedure, all the existing test steps in the database are marked with the new status "Obsolete" (earlier steps were deleted). In the second step, the system checks if the step exists in the file being imported. If not, the step in the database is kept with the "Obsolete" status, otherwise the step gets a status and inherits other parameters from the file being imported. When a Product Inspector script is run, a step with the "Obsolete" status behaves the same way as a step with the "Skip" status.
Test script import has been modified. When the file being imported contains scripts with the same codes as those already in the database, and the user confirmed update, the old behaviour was to merge data: script steps from the file being imported whose numbers matched those already in the database were rewritten, and all other steps in the database (if any) remained unchanged. The new behaviour allows users to repeat confirmation of the need to update the script and old steps are totally deleted before writing new data from the file.

CARDS-52474 / I1703160402

Product Inspector test script import has been modified when in the file being imported there are test scripts with the same codes that already exist in the destination WAY4Cards system. In the first step of the import procedure, all the existing test steps in the database are marked with the new status "Obsolete" (earlier steps were deleted). In the second step, the system checks if the step exists in the file being imported. If not, the step in the database is kept with the "Obsolete" status, otherwise the step gets a status and inherits other parameters from the file being imported. When a Product Inspector script is run, a step with the "Obsolete" status behaves the same way as a step with the "Skip" status.
Product Inspector test script import has been modified when in the file being imported there are test scripts with the same codes that already exist in the destination WAY4Cards system. In the first step of the import procedure, all the existing test steps in the database are marked with the new status "Obsolete" (earlier steps were deleted). In the second step, the system checks if the step exists in the file being imported. If not, the step in the database is kept with the "Obsolete" status, otherwise the step gets a status and inherits other parameters from the file being imported. When a Product Inspector script is run, steps with the "Obsolete" status are processed the same way as  steps with the "Skip" status.
If a step with the "Obsolete" status isn't necessary, it is recommended to delete it from the Product Inspector script.

Product management

CARDS-48673

Selection of Bank Date and Local Date for CS Status Log has been changed when a classifier value is restored by a Classifier Action. This is relevant only for those customers who use Reversal Management or/and Datamart.
Upgrade Note:
System behaviour in working with the the CONTRACT_ACTIVITY Event has changed: the CONTRACT_ACTIVITY Event is automatically triggered and the "CONTRACT_DELAY=Y" contract tag is set if the contract's period of inactivity exceeds the allowed ACTIVITY_DELAY period set in the Service Package or in the tag specified in the Product's Custom Data field. The "CONTRACT_DELAY=Y" tag is cleared if activity resumes. According to the new behaviour, Events with the CONTRACT_DELAY% code are automatically closed.
Previous system behaviour: a CONTRACT_DELAY Event was not automatically closed if activity resumed.
It is necessary to change custom configurations in which CONTRACT_DELAY% Event closing is forced.

CARDS-48133 / I1603100750

Selection of Bank Date and Local Date for CS Status Log has been changed when a classifier value is restored by a Classifier Action. This is relevant only for those customers who use Reversal Management or/and Datamart.
In versions 03.40 and 03.41 we recommend performing an additional standing order check using the "Check Template Orders References" menu item (provided by OpenWay Customer Support). This menu item checks links to order templates in inherited standing orders. Incorrect links (for example, to a deleted template) may lead to start of day and document processing fatal errors. Please import the menu item to the copy of the production system, run it and analyse the resulting process messages. If you have any questions, please send a separate request to Global Support.

CARDS-49650

Selection of Bank Date and Local Date for CS Status Log has been changed when a classifier value is restored by a Classifier Action. This is relevant only for those customers who use Reversal Management or/and Datamart.
Upgrade Note:
Fixed incorrect ageing of delinquent amounts when the MIN_DUE or MIN_DUE_AMOUNT tags are set in the account template. OpenWay Support provides a check script that should be run on a test environment prior to the upgrade procedure to find account templates with a possible incorrect balance. If the test script finds records with this configuration, contact OpenWay support for additional information.

CARDS-51878

Selection of Bank Date and Local Date for CS Status Log has been changed when a classifier value is restored by a Classifier Action. This is relevant only for those customers who use Reversal Management or/and Datamart.
Upgrade Note:
Contract Type settings will be validated on upgrade due to data changes in the "IPS Products" handbook. Process log and messages should be checked for reported errors and warnings after Contract Types validation, and the configuration should be corrected to eliminate these errors. Contact Customer Support for instructions on correcting errors.

CARDS-49022 / I1606010576

Selection of Bank Date and Local Date for CS Status Log has been changed when a classifier value is restored by a Classifier Action. This is relevant only for those customers who use Reversal Management or/and Datamart.
Product approval has been changed: Product Renew Mode has been added with "Minimal", "Check Contracts", "Check and Apply" modes. Previously the "Minimal" mode was used on Approve if a Product had historical AMND% records to decrease performance time. Now this mode is used by default. On Apply, the "Check and Apply" full validation mode will be used.

CARDS-50447 / I1609216346

Selection of Bank Date and Local Date for CS Status Log has been changed when a classifier value is restored by a Classifier Action. This is relevant only for those customers who use Reversal Management or/and Datamart.
The procedure for checking tags in the "Spc Parm field" when processing contract usage limiters has changed. In particular, the result of checking limiters with Inverse Conditions="Yes" may change. In the new behaviour, inversion is applied to the entire set of "Conditions" group parameters and tags specified in the "Spc Parm" field.

CARDS-52141 / I1702196631

Selection of Bank Date and Local Date for CS Status Log has been changed when a classifier value is restored by a Classifier Action. This is relevant only for those customers who use Reversal Management or/and Datamart.
Behaviour of standing orders with BY_BATCH tag has changed. Orders with "Order Type" different than "Debit Amount" and "Credit Amount" will not generate any transfers. Earlier these orders generated transfers based on account balance ignoring batch processing.
Configuration should be checked and if such orders are used, reconfiguration should be made. Either the BY_BATCH tag should be removed from the order or the Order Type should be changed to "Debit Amount" or "Credit Amount" depending on business requirements.

Reversal management

CARDS-52675

Corrected recalculation of due amounts on Intelligent Backdated Processing when REFRESH_DUE configuration is used.
Upgrade Note:
Forms to fill in reversal management actions parameters have been changed to use the tvf_visualisation table instead of the appl_info table. 
If customized forms were used for reversal management they should be changed the same way.

Risk management

CARDS-52022

Incorrect processing of several usage limiters with the same limiter type for one transaction is no longer possible.
Upgrade Note:
Fixed incorrect processing of usage limiters with the SingleSliding period type when the limiter's period was not defined for a particular contract with an application or manually. 
It is necessary to run the following query to check if this problem ever occurred:

select count(*) from usage_templ where limit_renew_type='s' and amnd_state = 'A';

If this query returns a non-zero value, contact OpenWay Support for further instructions.

SEPA interface

CARDS-47375

SEPA Customer to Bank Import: Now the posting status is "Waiting" for all reject documents.
Upgrade Note:
The PAYM_REC_PARTY table has been extended by the IS_READY field. On upgrade, the field value will automatically be set to "Y". When the corresponding PAYM_REC_PARTY records are edited, the IS_READY field value will be changed to "N".

Tariff management

CARDS-48946

Added support for THRESHOLD tariff role to tariff_domains_import/export and tariff_import/export pipes.
Upgrade Note:
The priority in which tariff sub-domains will be attached for a parent domain with the "ATTACH_SUBS" tag in the Apply Rules field can be set in descending order of priority specified in the "PRIOR" tag of the sub-domain's "Apply Rules" field. In previous system behaviour, tariff sub-domains were attached in random order.

CARDS-49057 / I1510145262

Added support for THRESHOLD tariff role to tariff_domains_import/export and tariff_import/export pipes.
Fixed incorrect creation of personal tariff domains registered in a card contract when reissuing a card with a different card number. To check for incorrect personal tariff domains in WAY4, run the check procedure trf.CHECK_PERSONAL_DOMAINS after upgrade and analyse the Process Log. The message "I Problems not found" indicates there are no incorrect tariff domain records. If there are "W Contracts for correction present" / "W Unknown case" messages with a list of contracts and tariff domains, contact Customer Support.
WAY4 Customer Support provides a separate test script that should be run in a copy of the production system before starting the procedure for upgrading to the new version.

Transaction management

CARDS-45160

IPS Transaction Inward: Now "Checking errors: [Wrong condition pairs...]" messages are skipped.
Upgrade Note:
Usage Limiter behaviour has been changed.
The changes are applied to all trans_type.is_authorized = Maybe transactions (Retail, for example) without any specific setup.
The following changes have been made:
1) Previously, device contract limiters were processed by POS and ATM controllers (during online transactions) depending on the global parameter "ACQ_OLD_USAGE_DIR". This parameter has the following values: "Y (default ) - only check/update "Transaction" limiters and ignore "Credit" limiters. "N" - only check "Credit" limiters, ignore "Transaction" limiters. When processing non-authorised financial documents (transactions (slips) entered manually or imported from a file) a "Credit" limiter was always used (regardless of the "ACQ_OLD_USAGE_DIR" parameter value). In the current version, processing of acquiring financial documents has changed (now the "ACQ_OLD_USAGE_DIR" global parameter is analysed as in the online phase). Therefore, if "ACQ_OLD_USAGE_DIR" is not set (default value of "Y" is used) "Credit" limiters will now be ignored and "Transaction" limiters (if any) will be updated in the device contract. The device limiter configuration should be checked. If "Credit" limiters are used, please contact OpenWay Support.
2) The "USAGE_FOR" tag will no longer be analysed for financial transactions for which authorisation is possible, i.e. the transaction type's "Is Authorized" parameter value is "May Be" (for example, for Retail transactions).
According to the document \manuals\english\Product_management\Usage_Limiters.pdf, the "USAGE_FOR" tag should never be set up for such transaction types, however, there was no check in the system and incorrect configuration led to duplication of limiter counters in authorisations and when processing financial documents. This has now been fixed.
3) When a reversal or adjustment is received (in a clearing file) for an authorised transaction, limiter amount counters will be updated (they were not updated in previous versions).
4) When reposting a document for transactions with the "Is Authorized" parameter value "May Be" (for example, for Retail transactions), limiter counters will be recalculated for the amount of this transaction (they were not updated on repost in earlier versions). Note that if the target contract for a reposted document changed, limiters will be reversed in the "old" contract and incremented in the "new" one. The same will be done in back office adjustments and reversals performed using the "All Docs" - "Doc-Brief" form.
The above changes apply to the following limiter types: "Transaction", "Risk Rule", "Credit". 
This logic is not applied to other limiter types.
5) When processing transactions with the "Is Authorized" parameter value "Never" (for example for salaries imported from the CBS) and the USAGE_FOR tag set, limiter counters are only incremented for the base transaction amount, fees applied to such transactions do not affect limiter counters (neither on presentment nor on adjustment). Please note that in earlier versions fee amounts affected limiter counters in such cases.

CARDS-45361

IPS Transaction Inward: Now "Checking errors: [Wrong condition pairs...]" messages are skipped.
Upgrade Note:
The default value of the global parameter PATCH_REVERSE_INTEREST has been changed from "N" to "0". Old behaviour: when reversing a financial operation, the posting date for the reversed document's macrotransaction was the same as the posting date of the original document's macrotransaction. New behaviour: the posting date of the reversed document's macrotransaction will be the current local date. This change means interest will be accrued for the period from the creation of the original operation to its reversal. 
To support the old behaviour, set the global parameter PATCH_REVERSE_INTEREST=N; OR contact Support for a free Reversal Management Limited module in which additional setup can be performed to process corrections automatically when reversing a financial operation. The free license is only applicable for DEBIT card issuing products. To implement this module for CREDIT card products, full Reversal Management module functionality is required with an additional project for product configuration. The Reversal Management Limited module is described in the manual <OW_HOME>\manuals\english\Reversal_management_limited.

CARDS-50545

IPS Transaction Inward: Now "Checking errors: [Wrong condition pairs...]" messages are skipped.
Upgrade Note:
Fee Collection document processing for affiliated banks has been changed. Now to accept these transactions, an additional row with the parameters category = "Account", transaction type = "Fee Collection Inc", Our Member ID = "affiliated BIN" must be added to the routing setup for the affiliated bank.
Also, Fee Collection documents can be sent through an affiliated interface. If it is not necessary to send these documents, set the "CAN_BE_ONUS;" tag in the BIN Details field of this member's BIN table.

CARDS-51960

IPS Transaction Inward: Now "Checking errors: [Wrong condition pairs...]" messages are skipped.
Upgrade Note:
Open form "Country Table" (menu item "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Country Table") and check that the record for Madagascar has the following values: Code (3 bytes) must be "MDG", Code (2 bytes) must be "MG", Code (Numeric) must be "450", Curr Name must be "MALAGASY ARIARY", Curr Code must be "MGA", N Curr Code must be "969".

CARDS-49655 / I1511033062

IPS Transaction Inward: Now "Checking errors: [Wrong condition pairs...]" messages are skipped.
Account to Account (Fee Collection, Funds Disbursement and Settlement) Interbank document routing and processing procedures have been unified. According to internal requirements, these operations can be processed inside the system (for example, documents for own IPS MemberIDs) or can be sent to an external system (for example, from a processing centre to an affiliated bank working on a Host to Host interface). To show an interbank document in internal entries, an IPS MemberID must be marked with the CAN_BE_ONUS; tag in the "Bin Details" field of the form OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Routing\BIN Table. Additional setup is required to record interbank documents sent to an external affiliated system. These special settings can be obtained in the scope of additional OpenWay services.

UnionPay interface

CARDS-47475

Union Pay Outward: Fixed problem with selecting documents for wrong channel.
Upgrade Note:
CUP Inward Processing/CUP Outward Processing: revised clearing and settlement message codes for compliance with CUP SMS. Manual action required! Several settlement message codes must be changed and several clearing and settlement message codes must be added according to the requirements of UnionPay International. Contact Support for details.

CARDS-53270

Union Pay Outward: Fixed problem with selecting documents for wrong channel.
Upgrade Note:
1. If message codes S2III1ZF, S2III2ZF, S2IAI1ZF, S2IAI2ZF are configured for the UPI channel (menu item "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Transaction Types\Message Types - All"), the bank should delete them.
2. Add the new transaction type "Fee Collection and Funds Disbursement Total" (menu item "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Transaction Types\Transactions - All").
3. Add new message codes S1--I--F, S2I-I1ZF, S2I-I2ZF, S2O-I2ZF
Contact Customer Support for details.

CARDS-53777

Union Pay Outward: Fixed problem with selecting documents for wrong channel.
Upgrade Note:
Manually add the "OUT_ST=Y;" tag in the "Msg Details" field of the "Message Types - All" form (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Transaction Types\Message Types - All).

CARDS-51706 / I1611079238

Union Pay Outward: Fixed problem with selecting documents for wrong channel.
New message types must be added (Full/Configuration Setup/Transaction Types/Message Types - All): 
Acq Reimb Fee Detail Online (Code S2-AF---0, Trans type "Acq Reimb Fee Detail"),
Acq Reimb Fee Detail Batch (Code S2-AF---1, Trans type "Acq Reimb Fee Detail"),
Acq Reimb Fee Detail Total Dispute and manual (Code S2-AF---2, Trans type "Acq Reimb Fee Detail"),
Iss Reimb Fee Detail Online (Code S2-IF---0, Trans type "Iss Reimb Fee Detail"),
Iss Reimb Fee Detail Batch (Code S2-IF---1, Trans type "Iss Reimb Fee Detail"),
Iss Reimb Fee Detail Total Dispute and manual (Code S2-IF---2.Trans type "Iss Reimb Fee Detail").

VISA interface

CARDS-47225 / I1510209357

Visa BII Outward: Added additional check for field Merchant City TCR0 Pos 117-129.
VISA: MCC (SIC) codes have been added to the standard configuration: 3167, 3177, 3183, 3188, 3211, 3521, 3600, 3601, 3784, 3786, 3787, 3788, 3789, 3790, 3791, 3797, 3799, 4723, 9702, 9950. If these codes are missing from the configuration, they must be added manually. Please check the table of codes and their groups, if necessary (main MCC table - OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\SIC Codes, SIC Groups must be checked additionally if they are used).

CARDS-52489

Visa BII Outward: Added additional check for field Merchant City TCR0 Pos 117-129.
Upgrade Note:
Please check the P_CEMEA parameter value that is used in "Visa_Statistics_Acquiring_Business" report generation.
In generating a report for CEMEA region, set the P_CEMEA parameter to "Y" or use the default value.
In generating a report for EUROPE region, set the P_CEMEA parameter to "N".

CARDS-49507 / I1606172243

Visa BII Outward: Added additional check for field Merchant City TCR0 Pos 117-129.
Visa BIN Table Import (pipe): BIN_TABLE.USAGE is filled with the "D"  value (was null) for PLUS BIN ranges.

To avoid creating history records in BIN_TABLE it is recommended to run a script before using the modified pipe for the first time.

UPDATE BIN_TABLE t
SET t.USAGE           = 'D'
WHERE t.CARD_BRAND    = 'PLUS'
AND t.DATA_SOURCE     = 'P'
AND t.USAGE          IS NULL
AND t.AMND_STATE      = 'A'
AND t.BIN_STATUS      = 'A'
AND t.BIN_GROUP__OID IN
  (SELECT ID
  FROM BIN_GROUP
  WHERE AMND_STATE='A'
  AND Channel     = 'V'
  AND ((CARD_ORG LIKE 'VRW%E')
  OR (CARD_ORG LIKE 'VCW%E')
  OR (CARD_ORG = 'EP')
  OR (CARD_ORG LIKE 'P%')))

CARDS-50317 / I1609202368

Visa BII Outward: Added additional check for field Merchant City TCR0 Pos 117-129.
Added the additional global parameter AFF_CH_LIST. If VISA transactions are processed through H2H channels with IsOnUs="N", these channels must be listed in this new parameter. Format for AFF_CH_LIST is <channel1><channel2>, for example AFF_CH_LIST = qwe, where "q", "w", "e" are the required channels.

CARDS-50883

Visa BII Outward: Added additional check for field Merchant City TCR0 Pos 117-129.
Upgrade Note:
VISA BIN Table Import: A new pipe parameter, COMMERCIAL_PRODUCT_ID=<product id1>,<product id2>,... has been added. BIN ranges are split into consumer/commercial categories: if a BIN range product is in the COMMERCIAL_PRODUCT_ID list, it is marked as commercial (CARD_PTI=2 tag in bin_table.bin_details), otherwise it is marked as consumer (CARD_PTI=1 tag in bin_table.bin_details). Default parameter value is "G,G1,G3,G4,G5,K,K1,S,S1,S2,S3,S4,S5,S6,". No manual action is required.

CARDS-51662

Visa BII Outward: Added additional check for field Merchant City TCR0 Pos 117-129.
Upgrade Note:
[VISA REL] Apr17-341 2.2 : The default value of the 'COMMERCIAL_PRODUCT_ID' pipe (VISA BIN Table Import) parameter has been extended. BIN range with the new commercial product ID 'X' will be marked as a commercial category. If a custom value of the 'COMMERCIAL_PRODUCT_ID' pipe parameter is used, it is necessary to add the new commercial product ID (code 'X') to the value.

CARDS-52234

Visa BII Outward: Added additional check for field Merchant City TCR0 Pos 117-129.
Upgrade Note:
Visa will implement changes to interregional and AP regional fee structures that apply to Visa Gold transactions issued from Japan. Acquirers must support the changes to the fee programs that will be assessed on Visa Gold purchase and credit voucher transactions for Japan issuers. According to this release requirement acquirers must configure Fee Program Areas in the Standard Handbook manually: Handbook Type is FEE_PREDICTION__FEE_PROGRAM_AREA, for Filter1 values "1","B","C","E","F" Name must be "Interregional" and Code must be "JPN". Furthermore, acquirers in the AP region must add an extra record in the Standard Handbook: Handbook Type is FEE_PREDICTION__FEE_PROGRAM_AREA, for Filter1 value "A" Name must be "Intra-AP" and Code must be "JPN".

Web banking

CARDS-43841

Problem with recurring payments appearing in web banking multiple times has been resolved.
Upgrade Note:
OpenWay\Published Services\Published Subscriptions has been extended by address type and the ability to set an event type or a classifier type for service enrolment and cancelation. It's necessary to run Refresh Dictionary to get these new possibilities.

Web services

CARDS-51680

New menu branches have been added: OpenWay\Web Services and OpenWay\Way4Web. The "WS Users & Grants" menu branch has been moved from OpenWay\System\DB Administrator Utilities to these new menu branches; the linked menu OpenWay\Full\DB Administrator Utilities\WS Users & Grants has been removed. For more details, see the section "Client Upgrade Notes on Impact changes".
Upgrade Note:
The "WS Users & Grants" menu branch has been moved from OpenWay\System\DB Administrator Utilities to the new menus OpenWay\Web Services and OpenWay\Way4Web. The link OpenWay\Full\DB Administrator Utilities\WS Users & Grants has been removed. If you have a Web Services or WAY4Web license and OpenWay\Web Services or OpenWay\Way4Web menu do not appear after upgrade, please contact OpenWay support.

Changes Grouped by Products

[AMEX interface] [ATM management] [Accounting] [Acquiring] [Acquiring authorisation] [Application management] [Authentication management] [Automated routines] [Bill payments] [CB Gate] [Case management] [Changes export] [Configuration inspector] [Core] [Core banking interface] [Customer profile] [Customer/account management] [DB kernel] [DB manager] [Data preparation and card personalization] [Datamart] [Diners Club interface] [Dispute assistant] [Distributed processing] [Fast track upgrade] [Fee Prediction] [Fleet cards] [Health monitoring] [High availability] [Host card emulation] [Host2Host interface] [Housekeeping] [Instalment management] [Invoice management] [Issuing] [Issuing authorisation] [JCB interface] [Loyalty] [MasterCard interface] [Mobile banking] [Money transfers] [Multiple financial institutions] [NSPK interface] [Notifications] [POS management] [Product inspector] [Product management] [Remote access] [Reversal management] [Risk management] [SEPA interface] [SOA] [Scheduler] [Security & key management] [Tariff management] [Third-party batch interface] [Transaction management] [UC interfaces] [UnionPay interface] [VISA interface] [WAY4 Web] [Web banking] [Web services] [e-Commerce acquiring] [e-Commerce issuing]

Change types:

  • Added New Feature
  • Changed Feature
  • Fixed Bug
  • New Task
  • Sub-task
  • Support of Payment System Release Requirements
  • Backporting

AMEX interface

  • [CARDS-44969]

    • Created a new pipe, AMEX Merchants Raw Data Import (com.openwaygroup.pipe.amex.merchants_raw_data_import.jar) to load per-transactional acknowledgments.

  • [CARDS-47587]

    • AMEX GFS: Added new pipe to import Inquiry and Chargeback Notifications. Use menu item "OpenWay\AMEX GFS\AMEX. Daily Procedures\AMEX. Inward Processing\AMEX ICNF Import" to run pipe.

  • [CARDS-47610]
