  • [CARDS-49583]

    • NSPK Proprietary: added support for PDS-2072.

  • [CARDS-49584]

    • NSPK Clearing: supported new DE22 values.

  • [CARDS-49905]

    • Added a new column, "Territory Code", for the NSPK "Acquiring Business" statistics report. This column contains the code of the territory where a device is located. The first two numbers of the OKATO code are used as the code.

    Updated Manuals: [mir_statistical_reports\MIR_Statistical_Reports.pdf]

  • [CARDS-50278]

    • NSPK: supported SIOM (NSPK fraud reporting system) for Issuers.

  • [CARDS-50289]

    • NSPK Outward: changed DE43 filling for ATM transactions.

  • [CARDS-50290]

    • NSPK Outward: for offline transactions DE38 is not unloaded.

  • [CARDS-50330]

    • NSPK Outward Processing: Added additional check for DE031.3 (ARN Date) DE031.3 in (ClearingDate-8;ClearingDate] and DE031.3 >= DE012.1

  • [CARDS-50331]

    • If DE38(Auth Code) exists and DE37(RRN) is absent in a First Presentment, the document is not unloaded.

  • [CARDS-51484]

    • NSPK SIOM Processing: supported SIOM processing for Acquirer transactions.

  • [CARDS-51488]

    Updated Manuals:

  • [CARDS-51594]

    • [NSPK REL] 17.1 B-02. NSPK Outward Processing will not export "1740-781" and "1740-782" messages if "NSPK_RELEASE"="17.1" global parameter is set.

  • [CARDS-51958]

    • NSPK Inward Processing (pipe): supported new G2C transaction processing.

  • [CARDS-51959]

    • Added the ability to validate a cardholder's date of birth together with other security values. See documentation for details.

    Updated Manuals:

  • [CARDS-53277]

    • Affiliated BII Outward Processing (pipe) : supported export of NSPK G2C Credit transactions.

  • [CARDS-53337]

    • [MIR REL] 2017.2 K-11: removed support of PDS2072 since 17.2 release. "NSPK_RELEASE"="17.2" global parameter must be set to support this functionality

  • [CARDS-53376]

    • [MIR REL] 2017.2 K-10: supported new PDS2175. It is used to export/import Card Acceptor URL containing Cyrillic characters. "NSPK_RELEASE"="17.2" global parameter must be set to use this functionality.

  • [CARDS-53641]

    • NSPK Outward Processing (pipe) : added the "COMMIT_INTERVAL" parameter to manage commit interval.

  • [CARDS-54003]

    • [MIR REL] 2017.2 B-10 NSPK Clearing Interfaces (pipes): supported new cash-to-card transaction processing.

  • [CARDS-54018]

    • [MIR REL] 2017.2 K-12 : supported "B" value for PDS0165.1 field.

  • [I1607313135]/[CARDS-50111]

    • NSPK MPE import: BINs of sanctioned banks starting with "67" are considered to be Cirrus/Maestro BINs.

  • [I1705026998, I1705127863, I1705153646, I1702208472, I1705297867]/[CARDS-53441]

    • NSPK Bin Table Import (pipe): if NSPK BIN range for VISA/MC is not found and smaller (fully included in NSPK range) VISA/MC BIN ranges exist, these VISA/MC ranges are copied to the appropriate NSPK BIN Group. To avoid copying and restore the old behaviour, the new "COPY_SUBRANGES"="N" pipe parameter must be set.

  • [I1705221304]/[CARDS-53272]

    • IPS Products. Updated according to last NSPK specification.

    Notifications

  • [CARDS-47606]

    • OpenWay\Published Services\Published Subscriptions is now used for online published service configuration - as SMS notifications - too. It allows to connect the service with the special address type for getting mobile phone or email data. Property link allows to set up the special events or classifiers for enrolling and cancelling the service. And also a classifier for choosing the preferred delivery channel.

  • [CARDS-51312]

    • Added new variables %TRANS_BONUS_ALL%, %TRANS_BONUS_AT:<AccountType>%, %TRANS_BONUS_LIST[:<Prefix>:<Expire>:<Days>]%, %TRANS_BONUS_DOC_ALL%, %TRANS_BONUS_DOC_AT:<AccountType>%, %TRANS_BONUS_DOC_LIST[:<Prefix>:<Expire>:<Days>]% for messaging about loyalty bonuses accrued as the result of some transactions. These variables can be used in client message setup for SMS Banking.

    Updated Manuals: [notifications\transaction_notifications\Transaction_Notifications.pdf]

  • [CARDS-47932]

    • Message converter has been enhanced to process new subsitution variables %AUTH_SCH_IDT:<AuthTypeCode>% and %AUTH_SCH_IDT_EXTENSION:<AuthTypeCode>% in notification templates. These varables should be placed in Address Data field of message template under Event Type, Service Package, Account Scheme or Product. Address Type field should be left empty for such message templates.

  • [CARDS-48121]

    • %AUTH_SCH_IDT:TELEGRAM% is default address data value for message template prepared to send through Telegram channel

  • [CARDS-48443]

    • To notify sender of Send-to-friend money transfer event SEC_CODE_EVNT will be triggered.

  • [CARDS-47104]

    • Clause for sorting holds order by doc__id has been added into menu item "OpenWay\Full\Daily Procedures\Document Processing Step by Step\Clear Old Pendings"

  • [CARDS-47137]

    • Generation of AUTH_UNBLOCK event when blocked amount equal to zero suppressed now

  • [CARDS-47497]

    • Fixed the filter in the "Event Message Text" form to display message subject.

  • [CARDS-47619]

    • Fixed Event generation when the 'ONE_FOR_DOC' tag is set in the Special Parameters field of an Event type.

  • [CARDS-51592]

    • Processing of Default Service (with id=0) for correct representation of the variables "%SERVICE$..." is added

  • [CARDS-51904]

    • In report "Cardholder Contract Statement", added calculation of values for %VAR% variables if they are set in the P_MESSAGECODE_P parameter.

  • [I1507014999]/[CARDS-47704]

    • Fixed incorrect processing of variables like %INV_PARTY_xx$PARTY_<field>% in message template and client's statement

  • [I1512189700]/[CARDS-47496]

    • An MTR_FIN_REVERSE Event is now generated if AUTH_T_R was not created.

  • [I1601170477]/[CARDS-47625]

    • Fixed incorrect substitution for variables which take their value from for doc.add_info tag.

  • [I1604104347]/[CARDS-48409]

    • Fixed infinite looping when the ADD_ADDR_TYPES tag is used in a message template.

  • [I1604117502]/[CARDS-48448]

    • Recovered previous behaviour: Notification messages for contract event will created even if evnt_msg_templ.code is empty.

  • [I1609233293]/[CARDS-50831]

    • Restored functionality of "ADD_ADDR_TYPES" tag.

  • [I1611154209]/[CARDS-51591]

    • Notification generation for expired fund holds unblocking has been corrected. A new event code "CLOSED_AUTH_DOC" has been added.

    Updated Manuals: [product_management\Events.pdf]

  • [UKROSCHB-WBN-20150720_1]/[CARDS-47467]

    • Supported notification of reversal MTR_FIN_REVERSE for Direct P2P reversal.

    POS management

  • [CARDS-46566]

    • Global Parameters USE_SUBDEVICE_KEYS and CREATE_EMPTY_ACQ_KEYS are declared deprecated. Keys are generated under the upper device contract. Keys are not generated and sought under SubDevice contract.

  • [CARDS-48740]

    • Final advice is supported for P2P transactions.

  • [CARDS-48771]

    • VISA C2C reversal operation is not included in db counters for POS cycles.

  • [CARDS-50354]

    • Value "A" to ACQ_ONLINE tag has been added. This value changes vice versa online status of operation in operation table.

  • [CARDS-50408]

    • POS Purchase with CashBack: fixed incorrect behaviour of partial reversal.

  • [I1605055066]/[CARDS-49401]

    • DOC.fx_settl_date is inherited from Preauthorization document when Sales Completion occurs.

  • [I1511020079]/[CARDS-47835]

    • Added the MATCH_REVERSE_ONLINE parameter. If a reversal is received more than "MATCH_REVERSE_ONLINE" hours after the original transaction, it will be declined.

    Updated Manuals: [product_management\Service_Packages.pdf] [transaction_management\Documents.pdf]

    Product inspector

  • [CARDS-39037]

    • When importing Test Scripts, a UI dialog is displayed to allow Scripts for import to be chosen.

    • Item logging in Product Inspector is supported.

    • Comparison Filters can now be used to compare only a specific part of a test log with a standard journal.

  • [CARDS-47129]

    • New steps 'Recalc Contract Date" and "Set Contract Date" have been added to the "For Contract" action group for Product Inspector. Added a response code check for these test steps.

    Updated Manuals: [product_inspector\WAY4_Product_Inspector_Manual.pdf]

  • [CARDS-47240]

    • Added logging Contract Parameter Export in Product Inspector. To enable logging, use the LOG_MODE=CONTR_PARM_EXPORT tag in Test Options or in Step Parameters. Contract Parameter Export values can be viewed in the newly form Test Scripts -> Last Contr -> Contract Info -> Cntr Prm Exp.

    Updated Manuals: [product_inspector\WAY4_Product_Inspector_Manual.pdf]

  • [CARDS-47242]

    • Logging of exceptional macrotransactions and GL Traces to a special table has been added in Product Inspector. Logging is turned on by default and regulated by the PI_LOG_GL_TRACE_EXCPT global parameter.

    Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf] [product_inspector\WAY4_Product_Inspector_Manual.pdf]

  • [CARDS-47329]

    • Deactivate order step has been added in Product Inspector.

  • [CARDS-47494]

  • [CARDS-47660]

  • [CARDS-47898]

    • The Create Group Script action in Product Inspector has been removed. Now Script export selection is available in OpenWay\Product Inspector\Test Scripts -> Actions -> Export by Group Code.

  • [CARDS-49862]

    • A new step type, "Set Contract Parameter", has been added to Product Inspector.

  • [I1511059658]/[CARDS-47106]

    • Product Inspector Test Scripts export with more than one standard configuration is supported.

    Updated Manuals: [product_inspector\WAY4_Product_Inspector_Manual.pdf]

  • [CARDS-46291]

    • Case Management activity user and case owners can be excluded from test log comparison in Product Inspector by setting the special tag CM_COMPARE_OWNER=N; in test script options.

  • [CARDS-46422]

    • Client parameters may now be specified when creating sub-contracts in Product Inspector using the "Contract: Create Sub" step.

  • [CARDS-47283]

    • Fixed an issue in the Test Script Import pipe that sometimes produced a connection pool timeout error.

  • [CARDS-48574]

    • Instalment Scheme search in Product Inspector steps has been improved.

    Updated Manuals: [product_inspector\WAY4_Product_Inspector_Manual.pdf]

  • [CARDS-48860]

    • Fixed behaviour when the current financial institution in local constants was cleared when the Product Inspector script launched.

  • [CARDS-49602]

    • A client created when running a test script will have the same "Client Type" field value as the contract.

  • [CARDS-49846]

    • Fixed attaching document addendums in the test script, now addendums will be attached with specified format.

  • [CARDS-49994]

    • Fixed error that occurred when opening the PI scripts form if the dbm.ini file included several identical keys in different sections.

  • [CARDS-50109]

    • Fixed information logging related to classifier's values in Product Inspector in case when a unique classifier code was defined in CLASSIFIER_LIST=<Classifiers_Code_List>; tag.

  • [CARDS-50162]

    • Fixed Product Inspector document creation for contracts with several plastics.

  • [CARDS-50217]

    • Warnings are now skipped when setting a classifier value in PI script.

  • [CARDS-50222]

    • Fixed error when Product Inspector script continued execution when included script failed.

  • [CARDS-51234]

    • A new "test_script_export" pipe parameter, SILENT, with Y/N values has been added for use from Scheduler. If the parameter value is "Y", no dialog message will be shown.

  • [CARDS-51449]

    • Added sorting by ID for application action logging in PI test results.

  • [I1512105914]/[CARDS-47207]

    • An issue with Trace mode setting when launching Test Script has been fixed. The Trace option should now work as follows: 1. Empty value: PI_TRACE_MODE global parameter is used. 2. No Trace: trace messages are not produced in Product Inspector Log Tree or in Process Messages. 3. Run with Trace: trace messages are produced both in Log Tree and in Process Messages.

    Updated Manuals: [product_inspector\WAY4_Product_Inspector_Manual.pdf]

  • [I1607210975]/[CARDS-49615]

    • Fixed "out of memory" error when loading large test scripts with standard script execution data.

  • [I1608026553]/[CARDS-49770]

    • Fixed product definition for creating subcontracts in Product Inspector.

  • [I1608108465]/[CARDS-49855]

    • Exporting product inspectors scripts is fixed. It now uploads all subscripts linked to the main script.

  • [I1611305656]/[CARDS-51348]

    • Product Inspector test script import has been modified when in the file being imported there are test scripts with codes that already exist: a UI dialog is displayed to confirm the script update. If script update is chosen, all the existing test steps will be deleted and the new one rewritten. This dialog window appears only if the pipe's SILENT mode parameter is switched off.

  • [I1612046735]/[CARDS-51874]

    • For the "test script import" pipe, added searching of CLIENT_TYPE values for the APPL_CLIENT.CLT tag with the additional condition "F_I=? and CCAT=?".

    Updated Manuals: [product_inspector\WAY4_Product_Inspector_Manual.pdf]

  • [I1703160402]/[CARDS-52474]

    • Product Inspector test script import has been modified when in the file being imported there are test scripts with the same codes that already exist in the destination WAY4Cards system. In the first step of the import procedure, all the existing test steps in the database are marked with the new status "Obsolete" (earlier steps were deleted). In the second step, the system checks if the step exists in the file being imported. If not, the step in the database is kept with the "Obsolete" status, otherwise the step gets a status and inherits other parameters from the file being imported. When a Product Inspector script is run, a step with the "Obsolete" status behaves the same way as a step with the "Skip" status.

    Product management

  • [CARDS-46272]

    • New object Block code is supported. Block code is a configured combination of Client and/or Contract classifiers or decisions which may affect a contract's base lifecycle functionality (switch ON or OFF the Product options for the contract).

    Updated Manuals: [core\Contract_and_Client_Classifiers.pdf]

  • [CARDS-50321]

    • Multicurrency normalization has been enhanced. Use MCN_MODE for account templates and normalization standing orders. For more information, see the appropriate documentation.

  • [CARDS-47164]

    • Added the ability to redefine some properties of an account template inherited from an included scheme. A new reference mode, "Redefinition", can be set in the account template to redefine priority, ageing priority, interest group, and balance list.

    Updated Manuals: [product_management\Client_Messages.pdf]

  • [CARDS-47455]

    • Contract prediction function has been enhanced. "To Pay" has been added to the standard report (CUST_STATE_STR_TO_LOG) to show the amount in the contract currency with the required payment.

  • [CARDS-48660]

    • Search for an available tariff with the "OVL_THRESHOLD" tariff type is performed in the context of current document data (for example MCC or Merchant ID). Separate "OVL_THRESHOLD" tariffs can be configured with the "If Preference Type" definition.

    Updated Manuals: [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-48673]

    • The ability to trigger multiple CONTRACT_DELAY% events (with fee charging or notifications) based on different contract inactivity periods is supported.

    Updated Manuals: [product_management\Events.pdf]

  • [CARDS-48706]

    • Contract functional dates have been enhanced. Now it is possible to configure custom Date Types and use them in Date Schemes. This feature can help to configure complicated Product setup when standard functional dates behaviour does not meet business requirements. However each business case should be analysed carefully and the decision to use a custom Date Type requires approval from the OpenWay product team in each individual case.

    Updated Manuals: [product_management\Functional_Dates.pdf]

  • [CARDS-49016]

    • Historical records are now saved in the APPL_PRODUCT table for changes in attached tariff domain contract parameters.

  • [CARDS-49286]

    • New Billing Date functionality has been implemented for issuing products.

    Updated Manuals: [product_management\Functional_Dates.pdf]

  • [CARDS-49288]

    • Names of document tags for storing amounts in decimal format with a decimal point can be now listed in the form OpenWay\Full\DB Administrator Utilities\!!! STAFF ONLY !!!\Main Dictionaries\Amount Format For Doc Tag.

  • [CARDS-49977]

    • The ability to redefine an entry due date from a custom document tag has been implemented. The tag DUE_DATE_TAG=<tag name> should be defined in the Service's "Service Details" field and the corresponding tag with value format 'YYMMDD' should pass in the document's "Add Info".

    Updated Manuals: [tags description]

  • [CARDS-50117]

    • New options to define the frequency for regular operation (fee charging or standing orders generation) are added: semi-annual and fortnightly.

    Updated Manuals: [tags description] [product_management\Standing_Orders.pdf] [transaction_management\Documents.pdf]

  • [CARDS-50401]

    • When re-ageing is performed and previous due account is not found in the contract, it will be created automatically according to the account template rules.

  • [CARDS-50405]

    • The ability to mark service pack to redefine the currency for fee account from "Parent pack local currency" to "child pack local currency" is now supported.

    Updated Manuals: [tags description]

  • [CARDS-50729]

    • Contract parameter code is allowed as value for the CYCLE tag on the balance type which triggers the classifier. Old behavior (the value of this tag is defined as a counter) is also supported.

  • [CARDS-51358]

    • Added the ability to define and show a past due date and period for a contract. Overdue balance should be configured to include all overdue accounts and the balance code should be specified in the PAST_DUE_BALANCE global parameter.

  • [CARDS-51416]

    • The ability to skip Tariff Plan inheritance has been implemented.

  • [CARDS-51759]

    • The ability to customize contract state information gathered during contract balance prediction on future date has been added.

  • [CARDS-51990]

    • OpenWay\Full\CMS Stat\Create Statistics menu item has been enhanced. Now it will connect a new group "PRODUCT_GROUP" that contains key elements of product configuration scope.

  • [CARDS-52140]

    • Checking of some contract balances, classifiers and parameters has been supported for specific contract roles.

    Updated Manuals: [tags description] [product_management\Client_Messages.pdf] [product_management\Events.pdf] [product_management\Service_Packages.pdf] [product_management\Standing_Orders.pdf]

  • [CARDS-52461]

    • Current Usage Limiter Template Id (usage_templ_approved.id) has been added to exception output for usage limiter-related Oracle exceptions. Example of new output: ORA-20666: caused by ORA-01476: divisor is equal to zero [];[PROCESS_LIMIT_TEMPLATE_APPROVED=2710; ]; ORA-06512: at "OWS.CUST_USAGE_IS_ACTIVE", line 32 ..... ORA-06512: at "OWS.AUTH", line 3054

  • [CARDS-53332]

    • Product Min/Max/Default credit limit amounts can be specified by threshold tariffs.

    Updated Manuals: [tags description] [product_management\Products_and_Subtypes.pdf] [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-53956]

    • Correct standing orders processing for terminal contracts with same Terminal ID in different financial institutions is supported. If this duplication exists in the client configuration, the global parameter ALLOW_DUPL_TERMINAL_ID should be set to "Y". In this case, standing order documents for device contracts will be filled with additional contract search attributes: Merchant ID, Member ID and Spc Scheme for source, Member ID and Spc Scheme for target.

    Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf]

  • [I1603100750]/[CARDS-48133]

    • Fatal error in Contracts Daily Update process has been replaced with a non-blocking error message if a template standing order has been removed but an inherited standing order remains active. To protect against such problems, the inherited standing orders validation script "Check Template Orders References.UPG" is provided by OpenWay support for configuration validation before upgrade. See Upgrade Notes for more details.

  • [CARDS-45114]

    • Financial document limiter processing has been fixed for adjustments.

    Updated Manuals: [transaction_management\Documents.pdf]

  • [CARDS-46504]

    • Due date calculation for MTP ageing component with Contract Due type has been fixed.

  • [CARDS-46540]

    • Due normalization has been improved for Issuing accounts with Due Types: Payment Due, Long Payment Due, Contract Due, Fixed Day Due. If several due items with the same Due Date exist for an account, then only one Due transfer will be performed for the total Due Amount.

  • [CARDS-46624]

    • Fixed incorrect inheritance of usage limiter properties from a template in a Service Package to a limiter that has been redefined for a particular contract.

  • [CARDS-46700]

    • Fixed incorrect processing of usage limiter additional criteria (i.e. by document tags) when the limiter threshold was overridden for the contract.

  • [CARDS-47620]

    • Full/DB Administrator Utilities/Special Contract Utilities/Recalc Balances for Contracts has been fixed for active overdraft blocking.

  • [CARDS-47890]

    • Use of the FEE_BASE_FROM tag for several custom fees with the same Fee Code has been fixed.

  • [CARDS-49387]

    • BT_SIMPLE algorithm has been changed.

  • [CARDS-49650]

    • Fixed incorrect ageing of delinquent amounts when the MIN_DUE or MIN_DUE_AMOUNT tag is set in the "Template Details" field of an account template. A check is required. For more information, see Client Upgrade Notes.

  • [CARDS-49864]

    • SET_CONTRACT_PARM API to set a contract parameter with Mirror To Classifier has been fixed.

  • [CARDS-49892]

    • Additional validations of the tariff domain code used for attaching a tariff domain have been added for configurations when the corresponding contract parameter has location in Classifier or Mirror To = Classifier.

    Updated Manuals: [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-49971]

    • Tariff Domain contract parameter validation has been fixed for "Billing Level Only" and "Top Level Only" parameters. Additional validation of the "Location of Current Value" field value has been added: the value for such contract parameters can be "Contract" or "Classifier" only.

    Updated Manuals: [core\Contract_and_Client_Classifiers.pdf]

  • [CARDS-50005]

    • Restored the ablity to set a standard classifier when a contract parameter with the same code and "Mirror To=Classifier" option is set.

  • [CARDS-51268]

    • Fixed processing of the ORDER_MIN_PARM tag for standing orders with BY_BATCH mode.

    Updated Manuals: [product_management\Standing_Orders.pdf]

  • [CARDS-51683]

    • Usage_Limiters_Css.current_status value now considers the state of Contract Classifiers, as before. When the condition is false, the value is "S" (Service Deactivated).

  • [CARDS-52353]

    • The process OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Renew All For Institution now correctly approves Service Packages with additional packs: first all additional packs, then main packages.

  • [CARDS-52997]

    • FX_RATE tag calculation has been fixed for DCC Info Inquire documents, when DCC_FX_MODE=CR, and IPS currency differs from Merchant and CH currency.

  • [CARDS-53169]

    • spac.RESET_INTEREST has been enhanced for custom cases, when Interest Rate should be changed from the Billing cycle start date after holidays, if Interest Rate should be changed in a custom procedure after a new billing cycle starts.

  • [CARDS-53994]

    • Validation of contract functional dates Late Payment Date (LP_DATE) and Full Payment Date (FP_DATE) has been enhanced for Set and Recalculate operations. The new value of these dates should be equal to or less than the contract's Next Billing Date + 1 day if the previous value met this condition. When Late Payment Date or Full Payment Date equals Next Billing Date + 1, it means that the LP event or FP event will proceed right before Billing.

  • [I1510063276]/[CARDS-46240]

    • View RM_SUSP_RULE has been modified to avoid impact to delete package of services or contract

  • [I1510156120]/[CARDS-46476]

    • The "Pers. Orders" link and the ability to create a new order by a template have been added for corporate contracts.

  • [I1512178596]/[CARDS-47230]

    • The "Activate Order" step will now pass when a warning message is returned. Previously this caused a failure of order activation when an Event was required for the order to be active and the Event was not posted at the time.

  • [I1603100476]/[CARDS-48171]

    • Threshold amount calculation for standing orders with the "ORDER_AMNT_PARM=TARIFF_TYPE_CODE" tag in the "Posting details" field and a tariff type with Role=Threshold has been fixed for multi-currency contracts.

  • [I1604238369]/[CARDS-48804]

    • "PARENT_LIMIT_PART" tag processing has been changed. Synchronisation of card`s credit limit with the account credit limit when it changes is performed according to the value of the global parameter "SET_CREDIT_LIMIT_MODE". After the period expires, the card`s credit limit is also restored to the original value (before the temporary credit limit was set). If the "PARENT_LIMIT_PART" tag is set in a Product's "Custom Data" (CUSTOM_DATA) field, but its value (percentage) is not defined, the card`s available credit limit for such contracts will be "0". The value (percentage) of the "PARENT_LIMIT_PART" tag in the Product's "Custom Data" (CUSTOM_DATA) field is only "initial", if this value must be changed, it must be done in the contract's "EXT_DATA" field. It's forbidden to set a fixed credit limit for a card if the "PARENT_LIMIT_PART" option is active for a Product.

    Updated Manuals: [tags description] [issuing\user_manuals\Issuing_Module.pdf]

  • [I1604282456]/[CARDS-48862]

    • Service Package and Account Scheme validation has been fixed when tagged data rules are present.

  • [I1606010576]/[CARDS-49022]

    • Product approval has been changed: Product Renew Mode has been added. When the FREE_SUBTYPE parameter is set, exhaustive validation of a Product's subtype BIN table range correspondence has been excluded.

    Updated Manuals: [tags description] [product_management\Products_and_Subtypes.pdf]

  • [I1606205888]/[CARDS-50255]

    • Additional condition by action_code = 'ORDER' for the link "Order Docs" at the forms All Usage Actions.srd, Storno.Events.srd, Usage Action.srd is added.

  • [I1608029106]/[CARDS-50076]

    • Fix standing order processing in case when order's currency exponent differs from the account currency exponent.

  • [I1608181057]/[CARDS-50001]

    • Added additional conditions for selecting inherited orders to synchronise "Reason details" with the template order during the MIGRATE_INHERITED procedure on upgrade.

  • [I1608182549]/[CARDS-50069]

    • Processing of product copy (Product template support and Copy branch) has been fixed. 1- Products which are not present in the template are not removed (Previous behaviour: removed with errors), 2- Product template integrity on product approval is now checked, 3- Warnings for product template references for whole tree are provided (Previous behavior - for top level only) 4- Product unlink procedure has been fixed

  • [I1608246647]/[CARDS-50065]

    • Fixed Fee Account search for child Service pack (case when Financial Institution numeration scheme was changed).

  • [I1608314913]/[CARDS-50066]

    • balance_type.amnd_date and balance_type.amnd_officer DB table columns now are updated for historical records during Balance Type validation process.

  • [I1609216346]/[CARDS-50447]

    • Fixed incorrect processing of parent usage limiter activity depending on document tags.

  • [I1609271918]/[CARDS-50760]

    • Regular fees are now calculated in OpenWay\Full\DB Administrator Utilities\Special Contract Utilities\Issuing Contracts - Balance Prediction.

  • [I1610157706]/[CARDS-50699]

    • During Apply Scheme Changes incorrect removal of Not Amount Available accounts for subcontracts with a See Main hierarchy has been fixed.

  • [I1611084649]/[CARDS-51053]

    • Contract activity date processing has been fixed for Fin Requests.

  • [I1702196631]/[CARDS-52141]

    • Fixed amount calculation for standing orders with the BY_BATCH tag; now zero amount orders are not recalculated based on account balance.

  • [I1704187095]/[CARDS-53269]

    • Usage limiter's end date calculation has been enhanced for usage limiters with Period Type = Billing for sub-contracts.

  • [I1705235303]/[CARDS-53377]

    • Selection of Bank Date and Local Date for CS Status Log has been changed when a classifier value is restored by a Classifier Action. This is relevant only for those customers who use Reversal Management or/and Datamart.

    Remote access

  • [CARDS-47920]

    • Procedures to On/Off usage limiter has been corrected to works in Telescope.

    Reversal management

  • [CARDS-53000]

    • Liability contract hierarchy is supported in reversal management. To allow intelligent backdated processing for a contract with liability subcontracts, the STORNO_LIAB tag should be set in its product; in this case, the whole liability tree will be recalculated.

    Updated Manuals: [product_management\Products_and_Subtypes.pdf] [reversal_management\Reversal_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-48857]

    • Instalment plans with the "SIMULATED' status are skipped in the correction process initiated by Reversal Management.

  • [CARDS-49273]

    • The USE_AUTO_STORNO parameter may be redefined for a financial institution, Product, or Service Package. USE_AUTO_STORNO=N should be set to prohibit automatic corrections for a financial institution or Product / Service Package.

    Updated Manuals: [reversal_management\Reversal_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-49869]

    • Classifier history is no longer deleted during the correction process. Corrected classifier values are marked with a special status is_active=Z for correct synchronisation with Datamart.

    Updated Manuals: [reversal_management\Reversal_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-52941]

    • The ability has been added to properly recalculate contract state with correction documents for fees and interest in intelligent backdated processing. Correction transaction types should be marked using the STORNO_DELAY tag with the "Y" value if a fee is posted in Contracts Daily Update with the preceding date and "N" if a fee is posted in Contracts Daily Update with the current date.

    Updated Manuals: [reversal_management\Reversal_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-46997]

    • Fixed an issue with missing reversal correction record, related to reversal in the current billing cycle.

  • [CARDS-47232]

    • Entries that have been recalculated by Reversal Management will now be hidden in the CSS Transactions screen.

  • [CARDS-47339]

    • Account billing log records recalculated in the Storno process are now considered when creating a Full Payment event.

  • [CARDS-47395]

    • End Date will be recalculated on reversal for a periodic event closed by another event.

  • [CARDS-47446]

    • Account billing log records created when processing a correction plan are now considered when creating Late Payment events.

  • [CARDS-47474]

    • Now the local amount sign for a reversal macrotransaction created by the Reversal Management module is not inherited from the original macrotransaction and is the same as in traditional reversal processing, i.e. has the inverse sign to an Advice macrotransaction.

  • [CARDS-47706]

    • DLQ_HIST tag value is restored from acnt_log in the correction process initiated by the Reversal management module.

  • [CARDS-47716]

    • Correct Due Account used during Storno process even if it was changed for specific normalization by a due normalization order.

  • [CARDS-47736]

    • Corrected filtering of limit normalization macrotransactions on reversal if they were created in an earlier reversal.

  • [CARDS-47789]

    • An issue with incorrect interest calculation on reversal has been fixed. The issue occurred when the reversal start date coincided with the start of a year.

  • [CARDS-47834]

    • Contract base dates for previous periods saved in account billing log records are recalculated in the correction process.

  • [CARDS-48180]

    • Fixed incorrect ordering of steps in Correction plan created with Reversal management module for Event, Classifier and Instalment Limit steps.

  • [CARDS-48249]

    • Fixed processing <Base functional date>_NEXT during billing in correction process initiated by Reversal Management module.

  • [CARDS-48385]

    • Fixed hanging of correction process initiated by the Reversal Management module.

  • [CARDS-48792]

    • ACTIVITY_DATE tag value is not recalculated and CONTRACT_DELAY Event is reapplied in the correction process initiated by Reversal Management.

    Updated Manuals: [reversal_management\Reversal_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-48999]

    • Supplementary account transfers are recalculated on correction processing.

    Updated Manuals: [reversal_management\Reversal_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-49353]

    • Conditions have been added to show only those actions that can be called for a document.

    Updated Manuals: [reversal_management\Reversal_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-49935]

    • Fixed recalculation of the DLQ_LEVEL, DLQ_LEVEL_INSTL, BEH_TYPE and other "balance type" related classifiers during the correction process.

  • [CARDS-52475]

    • In the Reversal Management module, correction of "Behavior Type" changes has been fixed when changes were done at correction start date.

  • [CARDS-52675]

    • Fixed changing of the "Is Ready" contract attribute when performing manual reversal management actions using DB Manager.

    Updated Manuals: [reversal_management\Reversal_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-52732]

    • Due tolerance configuration is now supported in backdated payment processing in the Reversal Management module. Maximum tolerance supported period is 10 days. In common cases it is recommended to use backdated payments instead of due tolerance setup.

  • [CARDS-53226]

    • Generation of corrections in intelligent backdated processing has been improved. When a liability tree is processed, corrections will be generated for transfers between Main/Sub trees in the liability hierarchy. Additionally corrections can now be generated for transfers to not amount available accounts, this feature can be enabled by setting the STORNO_NOT_AMAV_CORRECTIONS global parameter to "Y".

    Updated Manuals: [reversal_management\Reversal_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-53481]

    • Intelligent Backdated Processing functionality has been improved to correct balance history entry amounts for advice and reversal transactions when a balance type is specified in a custom fee service with an empty Fee Type reference.

  • [CARDS-53866]

    • Intelligent backdated processing now supports instalment event fees recalculation during the correction process.

  • [CARDS-54015]

    • Account renumeration is skipped during reversal processing contract initialization.

  • [CARDS-54116]

    • Backdated processing is now not launched for advice documents with current posting date if they are created in SMS mode.

  • [I1607194746; I1608110367]/[CARDS-49881]

    • Fixed restoring classifier values during the correction process.

  • [I1703235650]/[CARDS-53980]

    • Corrected recalculation of due amounts on Intelligent Backdated Processing when REFRESH_DUE configuration is used.

    Risk management

  • [CARDS-47758]

    • Unusable procedure rm_ecomm.PUT_FINGERPRINT_DATA has been removed

  • [CARDS-47773]

    • Added validation of ability to using together RenewType and Threshold Calculation Algotithm, filled in Usage Limiter Template at Approve procedure

  • [CARDS-49852]

    • Fixed incorrect restriction for usage operations in DDDW on form "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Alerting Setup\Usage Operation Request"

  • [CARDS-50551]

    • Negative Response Code (RC) usage call for not authorized presentment has been updated. it is no longer checked for processing of financial advice for which there was no authorization.

  • [CARDS-51938]

    • Technical operations have been excluded from the risk usage limiter processing. Technical operations are operations where transaction type and service class are not filled.

  • [CARDS-52022]

    • Fixed incorrect processing of usage limiters with the SingleSliding period type when the limiter's period was not defined for a particular contract with an application or manually.

  • [CARDS-52824]

    • Testing - Usage Recalculation: Restored the ability to recalculate usage limiter counters for acquiring.

  • [I1510208215]/[CARDS-46276]

    • Filling credit_history table records independent of RM_USG_CHCK_MODE parameter value has been restored.

  • [I1603286975]/[CARDS-48655]

    • DDDW for IPS Product code selection has been redesigned to avoid troubles in DBM

  • [I1606172131]/[CARDS-50886]

    • Technical operations have been excluded from usage processing except operational usages. Technical operations are operations where transaction type and service class are not filled.

  • [I1606280305]/[CARDS-50040]

    • Form "Usage Recalculation Result" show only records for recalculation processes now.

  • [I1610063157]/[CARDS-50788]

    • Fixed incorrect processing of predefined BIN values in merchant stop-list for risk monitiring

  • [I1611184862]/[CARDS-51289]

    • Corrected calculation of the amount sign for a parent usage limiter when the transaction direction and FOR_WHOM property both are opposite to the corresponding properties of the child limiter.

  • [I1702106547]/[CARDS-52437]

    • Fixed incorrect validation of merchant stop list conditions for the predefined condition "Suspicious Contra Party" in usage limiters.

  • [I1703038675]/[CARDS-52383]

    • Incorrect processing of several usage limiters with the same limiter type for one transaction is no longer possible.

  • [CARDS-51856]

    • A new risk report, "Exceeded Total Credit/Refund Transact. Nmbr to Total Purchase Transact. Nmbr Ratio" has been created in created in OpenWay\Acquiring\Merchant Risk Management\Risk Reports - Acquiring Single. It is necessary to set the TOTCRDRTRANSNUMRATIO risk scheme parameter (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Products\Acquiring Products\Device Risk Schemes) - Total Credit/Refund Transact. Nmbr to Total Purchase Transact. Nmbr Ratio.

  • [CARDS-51857]

    • A new report has been created, Credits_Issued_By_Merchant.rdf. The report is run from OpenWay\MC Statistics Reports\Risk Reports\Credits Issued By Merchant.

  • [CARDS-51864]

    • A new MC_Acquiring_Fraud_Basis_Points.rdf report has been created. It can be run from the menu OpenWay\MC Statistics Reports\Risk Reports\Acquiring Fraud Basis Points.

    Updated Manuals: [MasterCard_statistical_reports\Quarterly_MasterCard_Reporting\MC_Acquiring_Fraud_Basis_Points_Report.pdf]

    SEPA interface

  • [CARDS-46183]

    • SEPA: Added reject reason codes.

    Updated Manuals: [sepa_interface\SEPA_Interface_setup.pdf]

  • [CARDS-46940]

    • SEPA Customer to Bank Import: Supported processing a reject message as a chargeback to rejected document. This mode is default. To use standard the WAY4 reject processing mode, set the pipe parameter PROC_REJ_AS_CHBK=N. SEPA Direct Debit and Credit Transfer related trans types are added to Data Etalon.

    Updated Manuals: [sepa_interface\SEPA_Interface_setup.pdf]

  • [CARDS-47375]

    • The PAYM_REC_PARTY table has been extended by the IS_READY field to affect the corresponding PAYM_REC record when the PAYM_REC_PARTY record is edited. All existing records will get IS_READY='Y' in upgrade.

  • [CARDS-47646]

    • SEPA Credit Transfer mandates are supported in the SEPA Interface module.

    Updated Manuals: [sepa_interface\SEPA_Interface_setup.pdf]

  • [CARDS-47685]

    • "Activate" button for cancelled mandate has been removed.

    Updated Manuals: [sepa_interface\SEPA_Interface_operation.pdf]

  • [CARDS-47767]

    • ACTIVITY_DATE_TO and ACTIVITY_DATE_FROM fields of an individual standing order that is linked to a SEPA payment receiver are synchronised when the mandate's dates change: - date_from, date_to - cancellation_date - last_used_date.

    Updated Manuals: [sepa_interface\SEPA_Interface_operation.pdf]

  • [CARDS-48543]

    • The ability to create several active contract mandates with dates that do not overlap is now supported.

  • [CARDS-48545]

    • If a contract counterparty is created for a new contract, the approve process will be called for this new contract before the counterparty is created.

  • [CARDS-46135]

    • New forms have been created with the capability to repost/resend rejected SEPA direct debit/credit documents. When reposting, the document invoice_party record is copied from the original to the new document.

    Updated Manuals: [sepa_interface\SEPA_Interface_operation.pdf]

  • [CARDS-46541]

    • Old SEPA module: pre_function behaviour in the 'Edit' link of the SEPA.Mandate form has been changed so filter query modification may be required in the Edit Mandate custom form.

  • [CARDS-47365]

    • SEPA Export: Field "ReqdExctnDt" filling for credit transfer documents with the posting date

    Updated Manuals: SEPA interface | Functional Specification [sepa_interface\SEPA_Interface_operation.pdf]

  • [CARDS-47460]

    • SEPA Export: xsd validation problems.

  • [CARDS-48104]

    • A mandate's "date_from" is taken to calculate a standing order for the SEPA Direct Debit "Date To" field value if the mandate's "last_used_date" is null.

    Updated Manuals: [sepa_interface\SEPA_Interface_operation.pdf]

  • [CARDS-48557]

    • Added checks if the cancelation date and reason are filled when canceling an existing Mandate.

  • [CARDS-48733]

    • Fixed the issue when Accept for an application to activate an individual order failed if the linked mandate's "date_from" value was a date in the future.

  • [CARDS-50430]

    • Subitem Security Grants "SEPA Mandate" added to the menu items in SEPA\Issuing Mandate Input & Update menu. It allows access to clerks working with client and contract SEPA mandates

  • [CARDS-50915]

    • The AmdmntInd tag in a SEPA Direct Debit document is set only when changes in the mandate are of any concern for the Creditor Bank or for the Debtor Bank (when any of OrnglMndtId, OrgnlCdtrSchmeId, OrgnlDbtrAcct, OrgnlDbtrAgt tags are filled).

  • [CARDS-53556]

    • SEPA Customer-To-Bank export: creditor address data is exported for SEPA Credit Transfer.

  • [I1608299563]/[CARDS-50275]

    • SEPA Customer to Bank Import: Now the posting status is "Waiting" for all reject documents.

    SOA

  • [UFX-216]

    • Billing addendum saved during billing payment operation now includes more operation details in field 111.

  • [UFX-242]

    • UFX Statement: "MergeCustomFees" mode has been amended to support merging of custom fee entries that don't have a main entry.

  • [UFX-210]

    • Store-and-Forward can now be enabled for more UFX Doc message codes.

  • [I1508112549]/[UFX-230]

    • Fixed UFX schema: made AuthParameter/Value element optional.

  • [I1510076860]/[UFX-232]

    • Restored support for the IS_CUSTOM_FEE column in custom ordering rules for UFX statements.

  • [I1510161245]/[UFX-238]

    • WAY4CardsAdapter now uses AuthCode from UFX reversal request for matching with original request.

    Scheduler

  • [DBK-1943]

    • Included the directories HOME\install\way4manager and HOME\client\way4manager\components in the "WAY4 Scheduler" filter.

  • [DBK-1970]

    • ORA-06502 on attaching to a process with a lot of parameters

  • [DBK-2208]

    • Reports Engine R2 (batch mode) didn't fill P_CONNID parameter if it was launched from Scheduler.

  • [I1604262805]/[DBK-2047]

    • Scheduler R2 couldn't execute batch reports using Reports Engine R2. TNS name wasn't transfered to Oracle Report Server.

    Security & key management

  • [CARDS-46307]

    • Bug with repeated pipe starting has been fixed. New records that appeared since the previous start of the pipe are now dumped.

  • [CARDS-52807]

    • "PA DSS Implementation Guide" has been updated. The section "Encryption and Protected Protocols for Data Transmission" has been changed. Added a warning that when the TLS 1.2 protocol is used, encryption using the RC4 algorithm must be disabled.

  • [CARDS-52884]

    • "PA DSS Implementation Guide" has been updated. Full review for PA DSS 3.2 compliance (03.42.3.x, 03.43.3.x, 03.44.3.x).

  • [CARDS-53005]

    • Interactive channels API: a requirement for the value of the csrf_protection parameter has been added. The parameter must be set to "true" in accordance with PA-DSS.

  • [CARDS-53006]

    • Messenger banking: a requirement to not disclose private IP addresses has been added in accordance with PA-DSS.

  • [CARDS-53007]

    • Messenger banking: a requirement for the value of the session_expiry_sec parameter has been added. The parameter must be set to "300" in accordance with PA-DSS.

  • [I1703036213]/[CARDS-52262]

    • Incorrect reference to nscipher.exe has been changed to the correct <APP_SERVER>\appserver\bin\tools\nscipher.exe.

    Tariff management

  • [CARDS-48946]

    • Priority for attaching tariff sub-domains has been implemented for parent domains with the tag ATTACH_SUBS. The PRIOR tag should be used in sub-domain Apply Rules.

    Updated Manuals: [tags description] [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-48039]

    • The FOLDER tag can now be specified in Tariff Domain Apply Rules. The tag has the following effect: a Tariff Domain is not used in tariff search; Tariffs cannot be loaded or approved when located in a "Folder" Domain. The tag can be used in conjunction with ATTACH_BY_CODE and ATTACH_SUBS tags.

    Updated Manuals: [tags description] [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-48040]

    • The ATTACH_BY_CODE tag value specified in the "Tariff Domain Apply Rules" field defines the contract parameter whose value matches the unique tariff sub-domain code to be attached to the contract.

    Updated Manuals: [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-48217]

    • A new field, "Default Is Active" in Tariff Types configuration is supported for Usage, Service and Service Limit tariff roles. If the "No" value is specified and a tariff is not found: the Service will be marked as not allowed and Usage will be skipped.

    Updated Manuals: [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-48415]

    • Shift Base Date and Shift Result Date attributes can now be redefined by tariff apply rules for contract functional date calculation.

    Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf] [tags description] [product_management\Functional_Dates.pdf]

  • [CARDS-48870]

    • Links for Instalment-related tariffs have been added to the Tariff Data View.srd form.

  • [CARDS-49146]

    • A new field "Apply Rules" has been added to forms for viewing and editing Tariff Domains.

    Updated Manuals: [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-50007]

    • The "Active Tariffs" form, that could be found in OpenWay\Tariffs\Tariff for Contracts (Edit Personal) - Active Trf has been enhanced. When verifying tariff apply rules for a contract, contract conditions are checked.

  • [CARDS-50157]

    • The ability to set Usage Role tariffs from the current date has been implemented.

    Updated Manuals: [tags description] [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-51329]

    • The ability to use a discount for a tariff value has been added. Tag DISCOUNT_CODE should be added to tariff "Apply Rules" with the contract parameter code that stores the discount value as a percentage.

    Updated Manuals: [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-51415]

    • Supported automatic inheritance of a tariff domain contract parameter value from a sub to a main contract according to linked classifier value priority.

  • [UFX-237]

    • Tariff Data & Structure Import Pipe default behaviour has changed: it does not reject the incoming file on duplicate imports

  • [CARDS-47543]

    • Tariff import for tariffs with "Tariff currency" not marked as UseInBank=Yes is allowed. Note that Tariff Data currency still will be checked on import.

  • [CARDS-49115]

    • Tariff domain contract parameter inheritance has been fixed.

    Updated Manuals: [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-50921]

    • Tariff domain contract parameter initialisation error has been fixed for card creation application in check mode.

  • [CARDS-51836]

    • Optimized load of personal tariffs for large contract hierarchies.

  • [CARDS-52302]

    • Corrected loyalty action limit restriction if bonus service is configured for another contract using the CONTRACT_FOR tag.

  • [CARDS-53170]

    • Service limit tariffs with preference based on Issuer country (Area) can now be used for source services.

  • [CARDS-54044]

    • Links for "GL", "Billing Sch", "Inst Fee", "Interest Tax", "Inst Sch" have been added to the Tariff Data Input Individual form.

  • [CARDS-54126]

    • When approving a personal tariff, Tariff Start Date will be checked by the date of the contract's financial institution.

  • [UFX-271]

    • Added support for THRESHOLD tariff role to tariff_domains_import/export and tariff_import/export pipes.

    Updated Manuals: [tariff_management\export_import\xml_tariff_schema.chm]

  • [I1510145262]/[CARDS-49057]

    • Fixed personal domain creation in card replacement.

  • [I1611102688]/[CARDS-52306]

    • Added check of "Value Days" field length for "Service Value Days" tariff.

  • [I1611186375]/[CARDS-51136]

    • Fixed tariff duplication when a personal tariff domain was copied from another card contract during card replacement.

  • [I1701271032]/[CARDS-51919]

    • Changing Interest Tariff Apply Mode without changing interest rates has been enhanced.

    Third-party batch interface

  • [I1701316576]/[CARDS-52274]

    • RBS. Outward Processing: Added logging amounts: Total Amount from DB, Total File Amount, Total Source Amount.

  • [CARDS-48153]

    • RBS. Base24 Transactions Export: For AmEx/JCB/MIR/UPI NSPK transactions, CRD_FIID is filled with "NSPA"/"NSPJ/NSPK/NSPU" values.

    Transaction management

  • [CARDS-45160]

    • The processing of usage limiters during the accept procedure has been enhanced. Now non-authorised adjustments and reversals will affect usage limiter counters. See Upgrade Notes in in the Impact changes section for more information.

    Updated Manuals: [product_management\Usage_Limiters.pdf]

  • [CARDS-45361]

    • The default value of the global parameter PATCH_REVERSE_INTEREST has been changed from "N" to "0". Old behaviour: when reversing a financial operation, the posting date for the reversed document's macrotransaction was the same as the posting date of the original document's macrotransaction. New behaviour: the posting date of the reversed document's macrotransaction will be the current local date. This change means interest will be accrued for the period from the creation of the original operation to its reversal. To support the old behaviour, set the global parameter PATCH_REVERSE_INTEREST=N; OR contact Support for a free Reversal Management Limited module in which additional setup can be performed to process corrections automatically when reversing a financial operation. The free license is only applicable for DEBIT card issuing products. To implement this module for CREDIT card products, full Reversal Management module functionality is required with an additional project for product configuration. The Reversal Management Limited module is described in the manual <OW_HOME>\manuals\english\Reversal_management_limited.

    Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf] [reversal_management\Reversal_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-47153]

    • Message converter: Supported new pattern %TRANS_DOC_IS_AUTH%

  • [CARDS-47296]

    • Removed document tag BIN_TABLE_ID processing.

  • [CARDS-48414]

    • Transaction Processing: Applied new Transaction Condition processing.

  • [CARDS-48841]

    • Tags SIC_LIST, EXC_SIC_LIST, TRANS_FX now work for all tagged data validation. They can be defined under Preferred, they can be defined in Service in the Service Details field, in Usage Template in the Spc Parms field, and in Tariff in the Apply Rules field, in order to define the rules for document processing.

    Updated Manuals: [tags description] [product_management\Preferred_Counterparties.pdf] [product_management\Service_Packages.pdf] [product_management\Usage_Limiters.pdf] [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-49276]

    • The DECLINE_NON_AUTHORIZED global parameter can be redefined for a financial institution or for a particular document.

    Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf] [tags description]

  • [I1509171811]/[CARDS-47676]

    • Documents with category Is Authorization = 'Transit Auth' are now matched with "Fin" category documents for all outward presentments (IsOnUs = Yes/No).

    Updated Manuals: [transaction_management\Documents.pdf]

  • [I1603159906]/[CARDS-48390]

  • [I404248627]/[CARDS-40275]

    • IPS Transaction Inward: Now "Checking errors: [Wrong condition pairs...]" messages are skipped.

  • [CARDS-46370]

    • Added validation of current date before unfreezing funds.

  • [CARDS-47138]

    • VISA BASEII Inward History Processing/VISA BASEII Inw History Processing/Affiliated BASEII Inward Processing: Fixed filling doc.source_number/doc.target_number with empty TCR 1 Terminal ID.

  • [CARDS-47746]

    • Fixed incorrect filling of the credit_history.closed field when creating a matched record for a non-authorised financial document.

  • [CARDS-47805]

    • Matching of secondary transactions (reversals, adjustments) to original presentments has been fixed. The problem of incorrect matching only appeared in cases when the source number field in a transaction document is empty.

  • [CARDS-48613]

    • Fixed filling doc.auth_code for "force authorisations" (Call Referral)

  • [CARDS-48741]

    • Now we assume "offline" device authorisation is authorisation (doc tag ONLINE=Y/N)

  • [CARDS-48832]

    • Device data during secondary documents processing is filled only when the source contract is inherited from the previous document in the chain.

  • [CARDS-48890]

    • A routing contract is chosen considering document tags in custom rules.

  • [CARDS-49430]

    • Now we mark a transaction with NE% transaction condition without STAN as authorised.

  • [CARDS-50268]

    • Document processing in FROM_AUTH=SERVICE mode has been fixed (account selection for main and custom fee is fixed)

  • [CARDS-50545]

    • VISA, Affiliated Base II pipes: Removed the difference between Acquirer and Issuer Fee Collections. Standard forms for Fee Collection document creation have been modified. The new forms should be used. Interchange routing settings are required for incoming Fee Collection processing targeted to an affiliated bank. See the "Upgrade Notes on Impact Changes" section for more details.

    Updated Manuals: [transaction_management\Processing_Interbank_Documents.pdf]

  • [CARDS-50688]

    • Transaction Processing: Changed priorities for Transaction Conditions with Token.

  • [CARDS-50826]

    • IPS Inward Processing: Changed inward file rollback processing.

  • [CARDS-50907]

    • Transaction Processing: fixed document status set to to Reject twice during reject item processing.

  • [CARDS-51035]

    • Conditions for the "Message" link in the Mess To Mbr Incoming.srd form and the "Errors" link in the Doc - Grid.srd form have been changed: filtering by the Object Type field has been added.

  • [CARDS-51300]

    • Import of historic acquiring transactions has been fixed to support source contract custom search by Merchant ID (if the terminal ID is not present in WAY4). This functionality is only used during migration from legacy platforms to WAY4.

  • [CARDS-51347]

    • Transaction Conditions: Added default TC for POS Chip PBT/SBT Token and Contactless Transaction Conditions.

  • [CARDS-51646]

    • Non tariff-dependent conditions for usage limiters with tariffs are checked before tariff search to minimize database load.

  • [CARDS-51960]

    • Country Table: Revised record for Madagascar. Code (3 bytes) must be "MDG", Code (2 bytes) must be "MG", Code (Numeric) must be "450", Curr Name must be "MALAGASY ARIARY", Curr Code must be "MGA", N Curr Code must be "969". No impact on transaction processing.

  • [CARDS-52776]

    • Fixed error on posting of interbank documents.

  • [CARDS-52833]

    • Fixed definition of terminal category to search for target dispute contract in posting history documents.

  • [CARDS-53214]

    • Fixed incorrect filling of fields with source and target numbers for chargeback when a message contains EMV cryptogram data.

  • [CARDS-53572]

    • Filling of merchant information for Batch Header documents added on document accept.

  • [I1505106881]/[CARDS-47955]

    • Now the form "OpenWay\Full\Documents Input & Update\Documents Troubleshooting\Documents - Resend Rejected" can be used with the global parameter FINANCIAL_REJECTS=N (not only with FINANCIAL_REJECTS=Y).

    • Transaction Processing: Set the additional global parameter TRANS_ATTR_CHECK=N to stop checking transaction attribute integrity when posting a document. Check transaction attribute integrity manually with OpenWay\Full\DB Administrator Utilities\Special OpenWay Utilities\Interchange\All Docs Not Safe.

  • [I1701242974]/[CARDS-51980]

Please modify them manually in OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Transaction Types\Message Types.

WITHOUT_ONLINE=Y should be used when CUP transactions were received from H2H with the required tags and we don't have coms_log records for them (online is not in WAY4).

  • [CARDS-45226]

  • [CARDS-46989]

    • VISA BII Inward Processing : Added the ability to assign MULTICURRENCY_OIF_<ProcBIN>, VSS_HIGH_SRE_<ProcBIN>, MULTICURRENCY_<ProcBIN> parameters using a new form. To use the form, it is necessary to configure the parameters MULTICURRENCY_OIF_<ProcBIN>, VSS_HIGH_SRE_<ProcBIN>, MULTICURRENCY_<ProcBIN> in special forms called from OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Member Parameters in the same logical way as in the pipe, and remove these parameters from pipe settings.

    • Visa Inward: some technical changes have been made for processing settlement documents.

  • [CARDS-48722]

    • Affiliated Base II Inward: Added additional check to prevent posting of documents with ONUS source_channel from file, that is not loaded yet.

  • [CARDS-51475]

    • The logic has been changed for calculating total active cards and total cards in the following QMR Issuing reports: "AMEX Statistics Issuing", "MC Statistics Issuing", "Visa Statistics Issuing". A card that has been reissued (when the contract with old card number hasn't been closed) is taken into account only once for "number of total cards in circulation" and "number of active cards".

  • [CARDS-53201]

    • VISA VCF Export (pipe): added possibility to redefine card numbers for some accounts on export for mixed company structure. Prefixes of these accounts must be listed in "ACCOUNT_PREFIX" pipe parameter value, which must be separated by commas. "CUST_GET_CARD_NUMBER" new pipe parameter must contain sql expression, which returns redefined card number value.

    • In the "XLS_Visa_Statistics_Acquiring_Business.rdf" report: 1. Changed the default value of the P_V_PAY_BRAND_NAME parameter from "V PAY" to "V_V". 2.     • To implement the latest requirements for Visa Operating Certificates (QMR) Reports issued 9 June 2016: Issuing Report: In the Card Issuance portion of the operating certificates, Visa has removed metrics previously attributed to the "Number of Active Cards" and added a section called "Number of Issued Chip Cards."   • [CARDS-51637]

    • [VISA REL] Apr17-376 4.5: supported new "Payment Account Reference" field in BASE II Draft Data Transactions. If this field has a meaningful value in an incoming transaction it is stored in the "PAR" tag in the document.

  • [CARDS-51639]

    • [VISA REL] Apr17-364 3.9 : supported Enhanced TC33 Acquirer Capture file format changes.

  • [CARDS-51649]

    • For the "Visa Statistics Acquiring Business" report: - added a new block "MERCHANT ACQUIRING TOTAL" with sums of regional volumes. - calculation of "Sales - of which Electron" subsection in the transaction section has been supported. - the sections "No. of terminals installed at merchants" and "Number of mPOS terminals installed at merchants" have been renamed to "No. of terminals active at merchants" and "Number of mPOS terminals active at merchants". These sections contain information about terminals on which at least one transaction was made during the report period.

    Updated Manuals: [visa_statistical_reports\quarterly_operating_certificates\VISA_Statistical_Reports.pdf]

  • [CARDS-51660]

    • VISA Interface: added support of Merchant Initiated Transactions.

  • [CARDS-51662]

    • [VISA REL] Apr17-341 2.2 : Added new Commercial Product ID 'X' to the default value of the 'COMMERCIAL_PRODUCT_ID' pipe parameter.

  • [CARDS-51693]

    • VISA Enhanced Acquirer Capture File Import (pipe): the value of the "Purchase Identifier" field (TC33 CP01 TCR1 pos 45-69) is stored in the document's "PURCH_ID" tag instead of in the "CS_PURCH_ID" tag used earlier. VISA BASE II Outward pipe: supported export of the "Purchase Identifier" field (TC05 TCR1 pos 133-157) from the "PURCH_ID" tag.

  • [CARDS-51776]

    • VISA Stop List: Added action codes (request codes) 14 and 54 to the Standard Handbook.

  • [CARDS-51784]

    • VISA BII ONUS Outward Processing: added new "PAN_FROM_TKN" parameter, if set to 'Y' and the "D_TKN" tag is not null, the "D_TKN" tag value will be exported in TCR0 pos 05-23 Account Number field instead of the "doc.TARGET_NUMBER" value.

  • [CARDS-51808]

    • [VISA REL] Apr17-390 2.14 : supported new "Token Requestor ID" field in "TCR4 - Supplemental Financial Data" in BASE II Draft Data Transactions. If this field has a meaningful value in the incoming transaction it is stored in the "WSP_REQ_ID" tag of the document.

  • [CARDS-51831]

    • VISA Outward: export of TCR3 record for AFT transactions is supported.

  • [CARDS-51869]

    • TKN_ACTIVATION and TKN_VERIFICATION requests are connected with Lifecycle identifier. TKN_VERIFICATION and TKN_ACTIVATION_CODE requests are connected with Token reference identifier.

    • Card metadata element in Check Eligibility Response has been set for Visa tokenization transactions.

  • [CARDS-51931]

    • The GetCVM method in the VDEP interface returns address information.

  • [CARDS-52046]

    • VISA Enhanced Acquirer Capture File Import pipe: added filling doc.settlement_amount and currency with Original Price Amount and Original Price Currency Code values from incoming file for DCC transactions.

  • [CARDS-52169]

    • VISA Enhanced TC33 Acquirer Capture import pipe: "Total Authorization Amount" field is stored in the document for further export.

  • [CARDS-52188]

    • VISA VCF Export: additional customization points have been added.

  • [CARDS-52189]

    • VISA VCF Export: added the "ACCOUNT_PREFIX" parameter to define the first symbols of accounts for special processing. Default value is "CH".

  • [CARDS-52190]

    • VISA VCF Export: added "REPORT_TO_LINK_T10" and "PARENT_LINK_T10" parameters which make it possible to override "REPORT_TO_LINK" and "PARENT_LINK" parameters for T10 records. Added "TWO_LEVEL_STRUCTURE"="Y"/"N"(default) parameter. If "Y" it is allowed to set the parent link for card directly to a corporate contract.

  • [CARDS-52321]

    • VISA Enhanced Acquirer Capture file Import: added JCB specific for further export ECI (PDE3009) to JCB.

  • [CARDS-52343]

    • VISA VCF Export (pipe) : added the "FIN_TRANS_SPLIT" parameter which allows a fee transaction to be exported separately from the main transaction. Added the "ADD_FIELDS_T5_FEE" parameter to redefine T5 record fields for fee transactions. Added the "FIN_ADD_FIELD" parameter for customizing transactions select.

  • [CARDS-52344]

    • VISA VCF Export (pipe) : added "PAN_LENGTH_19" pipe parameter which allows account number fields with a length of 19 digits to be exported. Leading zeroes are added if necessary.

  • [CARDS-52345]

    • VISA VCF Export (pipe): added "T1_FOR_T5" = Y/N(default) pipe parameter which allows export of T1 records when T5 records exist even if the billing period is not being closed.

  • [CARDS-52346]

    • VISA VCF Export (pipe): additional customization points for T1 Last Payment Amount ( F292 ) and T1 Last Payment Date (F308 ) have been added.

  • [CARDS-52373]

    • VISA Prepare Outward Files (procedure): added the "COMMIT_BY" parameter to control intermediate commits. Possible values: BATCH/FILE/PROCESS(default).

  • [CARDS-52375]

    • A new section "Configuring a New Product B2B Virtual Payments Program" has been added to the 2017_04_VISA_Requirements.pdf document.

  • [CARDS-52394]

    • [VISA REL] Apr17-340 2.1 Processing Requirements for Staged Digital Wallet Transactions. TCR3 record type "CR" is exported for SDWO transactions if this transaction doesn't contain industry specific TCR3.

  • [CARDS-52412]

    • VISA VCF Export (pipe) : added customization points.

  • [CARDS-52431]

    • VISA VCF Export (pipe) : improved export of transactions which do not have a document.

  • [CARDS-52651]

    • Added Message Channels "Q" and "q" for IPS Mercury. Added Mercury Premium and Mercury Non-Premium products to IPS Products.

  • [CARDS-53567]

    • VISA VCF Export (pipe): added new "GET_CARDS_HINT", "GET_CARDS_IDS_HINT", "GET_CARDHOLDERS_HINT" pipe parameters to define Oracle hints for appropriate selects. Parameter values must contain the entire hint including comment symbols, for example GET_CARDS_HINT=/*+cardinality(card 20)*/
