      • CARDS-47513 [NSPK interface] NSPK Outward: added additional check for Card Acceptor State field.
      • CARDS-47529 [Fleet cards] Fleet usage amount calculation for adjustment posting has been corrected: tgt_fee amount for an advice document is decreased by the tgt_fee amount for the adjustment.
      • CARDS-47535 [Dispute assistant] DA v2. Supported case creation and chargeback processing if a presentment has multiple adjustments.
      • CARDS-47542 [UnionPay interface] CUP Outward Processing: Added the pipe parameter WITHOUT_ONLINE (values: Y/N, Default: N) to fill fields "transmission date and time" and "system trace audit number" from document tags and not from coms_log. WITHOUT_ONLINE=Y should be used when CUP transactions were received from H2H with the required tags and we don't have coms_log records for them (online is not in WAY4).
      • CARDS-47614 [Core] Now usages are not corrected when documents are processed for adjustments based on auth adjustments.

    • 03.42.99.10
      • CARDS-46272 [Product management] New object Block code is supported. Block code is a configured combination of Client and/or Contract classifiers or decisions which may affect a contract's base lifecycle functionality (switch ON or OFF the Product options for the contract).
      • CARDS-47006 [NSPK interface] NSPK: supported "Reverse File" functionality.
      • CARDS-47021 [NSPK interface] Added menu item OpenWay\Full\DB Administrator Utilities\Special OpenWay Utilities\Interchange\NSPK Reverse Outgoing File.
      • CARDS-47385 [Issuing] Added support of card's contracts with nonunique contract_number field values on authentication server.
      • CARDS-39037 [Product inspector] When importing Test Scripts, a UI dialog is displayed to allow Scripts for import to be chosen.
      • CARDS-45160 [Transaction management] The processing of usage limiters during the accept procedure has been enhanced. Now non-authorised adjustments and reversals will affect usage limiter counters. See Upgrade Notes in in the Impact changes section for more information.
      • CARDS-45226 [VISA interface] VISA clearing: supported V.me.
      • CARDS-45361 [Transaction management] The default value of the global parameter PATCH_REVERSE_INTEREST has been changed from "N" to "0". Old behaviour: when reversing a financial operation, the posting date for the reversed document's macrotransaction was the same as the posting date of the original document's macrotransaction. New behaviour: the posting date of the reversed document's macrotransaction will be the current local date. This change means interest will be accrued for the period from the creation of the original operation to its reversal. To support the old behaviour, set the global parameter PATCH_REVERSE_INTEREST=N; OR contact Support for a free Reversal Management Limited module in which additional setup can be performed to process corrections automatically when reversing a financial operation. The free license is only applicable for DEBIT card issuing products. To implement this module for CREDIT card products, full Reversal Management module functionality is required with an additional project for product configuration. The Reversal Management Limited module is described in the manual <OW_HOME>\manuals\english\Reversal_management_limited.
      • CARDS-45787 [Product inspector] Comparison Filters can now be used to compare only a specific part of a test log with a standard journal.
      • CARDS-46566 [POS management] Global Parameters USE_SUBDEVICE_KEYS and CREATE_EMPTY_ACQ_KEYS are declared deprecated. Keys are generated under the upper device contract. Keys are not generated and sought under SubDevice contract.
      • CARDS-46699 [Invoice management] Invoices amounts can be shown with High Precision.
      • CARDS-46940 [SEPA interface] SEPA Customer to Bank Import: Supported processing a reject message as a chargeback to rejected document. This mode is default. To use standard the WAY4 reject processing mode, set the pipe parameter PROC_REJ_AS_CHBK=N. SEPA Direct Debit and Credit Transfer related trans types are added to Data Etalon.
      • CARDS-47078 [Acquiring] Button "Change RID" on "Add Service Type" form has been created. Billing RID can be changed on new value for certain selection.
      • CARDS-47100 [Instalment management] The Instalment Shift period now can be limited by a minimum and maximum length in an Instalment Scheme
      • CARDS-47117 [Multiple financial institutions] The ability to create a Bank Division from the Branch form has been added.
      • CARDS-47129 [Product inspector] New steps 'Recalc Contract Date" and "Set Contract Date" have been added to the "For Contract" action group for Product Inspector. Added a response code check for these test steps.
      • CARDS-47153 [Transaction management] Message converter: Supported new pattern %TRANS_DOC_IS_AUTH%
      • CARDS-47164 [Product management] Added the ability to redefine some properties of an account template inherited from an included scheme. A new reference mode, "Redefinition", can be set in the account template to redefine priority, ageing priority, interest group, and balance list.
      • CARDS-47181 [Multiple financial institutions] The Liability Contract column has been removed from Branch forms.
      • CARDS-47214 [Acquiring authorisation] Transactions for device contracts in the "Not Ready" state are possible for "virtual" terminals if this state is not related to a change in the Service Package, Accounting Scheme, or contract currency.
      • CARDS-47231 [Customer/account management] Validation of a standing order with an individual counterparty checks that its transaction direction corresponds to the counterparty type: Payee or Payer: debit orders should be connected with Payer, credit orders with Payee. For Normalisation and Norm Advice order types the counterparty type is not validated.
      • CARDS-47242 [Product inspector] Logging of exceptional macrotransactions and GL Traces to a special table has been added in Product Inspector. Logging is turned on by default and regulated by the PI_LOG_GL_TRACE_EXCPT global parameter.
      • CARDS-47273 [Invoice management] A new global parameter, DO_NOT_SCAN_INVOICES, has been added. This parameter regulates the scanning of invoices on CDU.
      • CARDS-47279 [Customer profile] Multi level additional authentication model using in Customer Profile can be set up in DBM forms.
      • CARDS-47287 [Fleet cards] Response Code value 78 returned instead of common value 12 in F0.EA.FFXX.D4 fleet bertlv tag if no records found in fleet goods dictionary for received Goods Code.
      • CARDS-47296 [Transaction management] Removed document tag BIN_TABLE_ID processing.
      • CARDS-47329 [Product inspector] Deactivate order step has been added in Product Inspector.
      • I1503054412 [VISA interface] [CARDS-47216] VISA: Added message type "CH Debit Adj" with message code "2513J1". Affiliated: Added message types "CH Debit Adj" with message code "2513J1" and "CH Payment Adj" with message code "2614J2".
      • I1510209357 [VISA interface] [CARDS-47225] VISA: Added MCC (SIC) codes: 3167, 3177, 3183, 3188, 3211, 3521, 3600, 3601, 3784, 3786, 3787, 3788, 3789, 3790, 3791, 3797, 3799, 4723, 9702, 9950. Manual action required! Check your configuration.
      • I1511059658 [Product inspector] [CARDS-47106] Product Inspector Test Scripts export with more than one standard configuration is supported.
      • I1512035347 [Money transfers] [CARDS-47254] CPNA, CPBD, CPCY, CPST, CPCN, CPAD, CPPC, UTRN tags are available for Visa domestic transfers.
      • I306131103 [Accounting] [CARDS-35977] Trace has been added to the account renumeration precedure OpenWay\Full\DB Administrator Utilities\Special Contract Utilities\Renumber Subsidiary GL Account
      • CARDS-40745 [MasterCard interface] MasterCard IRD Calculation: Supported ALM by the additional global parameter MC_CALC_IRD_ALM=Y.
      • CARDS-42826 [Core] SAVE_TGT_FEE/SAVE_SRC_FEE tag behaviour for adjustments has been fixed. Concerns XF_FEE_PREDICTION fees.
      • CARDS-44017 [MasterCard interface] IRD config autofilling: fixed IRD for Cash Disbursement for CPI=MCC,DMC.
      • CARDS-44609 [MasterCard interface] IRD config autofilling: Fixed product_id filling to consider not only CONFIG PRD_TYPE but also MPE_IP0052T1.Product_Type_Id.
      • CARDS-45273 [VISA interface] RA configuration has been modified for Visa International.
      • CARDS-45379 [Core] A classifier's bank_date is now inherited from the posting date of the macrotransaction if it is created in the EOD posting process, or from the Event start date if it is generated when posting an Event. A Decision's bank_date is now inherited from the trigger classifier bank_date. Decision bank_date and bank_date_to are now recorded in the decision log.
      • CARDS-46007 [VISA interface] VISA VCF Export: Fixed NPE on T1 forming when parameters PAST_DUE_1_CYCLE_CODE, PAST_DUE_2_CYCLES_CODE, ...PAST_DUE_6_CYCLES_CODE, PAST_DUE_X_CYCLES_CODE are not specified.
      • CARDS-46135 [SEPA interface] New forms have been created with the capability to repost/resend rejected SEPA direct debit/credit documents. When reposting, the document invoice_party record is copied from the original to the new document.
      • CARDS-46214 [Issuing authorisation] Fixed incorrect processing of authorisation request for partial approval when a card's available amount is equal to zero.
      • CARDS-46232 [Fleet cards] Authorization Retail Item document no more created if transaction declined.
      • CARDS-46238 [NSPK interface] NSPK outward: fixed incorrect filling of PDS-0025.02.
      • CARDS-46242 [MasterCard interface] MasterCard IPM Outward: Changed pipe parameter TRAILER_CHECKS default value to "N".
      • CARDS-46262 [Issuing authorisation] Fixed incorrect reversal of fee document which was created by a usage limiter for non-transaction operations (Change PIN, Balance Inquire etc.) in the Clear Old Pendings process.
      • CARDS-46266 [NSPK interface] NSPK interface: directory parameters have been added: NSPK outward: OUTPUT_DIRECTORY NSPK inward: SOURCE_DIR
      • CARDS-46267 [NSPK interface] NSPK Interface: Process names have been changed: NSPK Outward : "NSPK Outward Processing" NSPK Inward : "NSPK Inward Processing"
      • CARDS-46268 [NSPK interface] NSPK Outward - Null Pointer Exception fixed.
      • CARDS-46269 [NSPK interface] NSPK Outward: pipe now logs an error, not a warning when a document is suspended.
      • CARDS-46289 [NSPK interface] NSPK Outward - the pipe truncates F41 (Card Acceptor Terminal Id) to 8 symbols.
      • CARDS-46291 [Product inspector] Case Management activity user and case owners can be excluded from test log comparison in Product Inspector by setting the special tag CM_COMPARE_OWNER=N; in test script options.
      • CARDS-46307 [Security & key management] Bug with repeated pipe starting has been fixed. New records that appeared since the previous start of the pipe are now dumped.
      • CARDS-46321 [Application management] An issue with Tariff Name auto-creation has been fixed for tariff personalisation applications working in old mode (see OLD_PERS_TARIFF_LOAD_MODE global parameter).
      • CARDS-46341 [MasterCard interface] IRD configuration has been modified. Restrictions by Service Code (1,5,7) have been added for IRD 88,84 for some EU countries.
      • CARDS-46370 [Transaction management] Added validation of current date before unfreezing funds.
      • CARDS-46388 [Data preparation and card personalization] New boolean parameter TRUNCATE_MAILER_FIELDS supported in PIN Mailer Printing pipe
      • CARDS-46393 [Acquiring] RPNA tag is generated according to MasterCard requirements
      • CARDS-46406 [Dispute assistant] DA v2: The messages "DA: Cannot find dispute case for Previous doc." and "Cannot find dispute case for the Previous doc id" have been moved to Debug level.
      • CARDS-46412 [Dispute assistant] DA v2: Card Number filling for Fee Collection document in orphaned chargeback cases.
      • CARDS-46419 [CB Gate] Fixed incorrect Core Banking system response for advice or adjustment message when available amount less than required hold
      • CARDS-46428 [CB Gate] Fixed problems with reading CB Gate setup when integrating to CBS via Transaction Server using iRouter channel instead of NetServer CBGate channel.
      • CARDS-46448 Client search procedure now restricts the result by SearchScope
      • CARDS-46468 [NSPK interface] NSPK Inward: Null Pointer Exception fixed.
      • CARDS-46470 [VISA interface] RA configuration has been modified for Visa International.
      • CARDS-46504 [Product management] Due date calculation for MTP ageing component with Contract Due type has been fixed.
      • CARDS-46521 [NSPK interface] NSPK Outward: Null Pointer Exception fixed.
      • CARDS-46539 [Issuing authorisation] OFFLINE_PIN_UNBLOCK processing analyses incorrect PIN counter the same as for the other operations.
      • CARDS-46541 [SEPA interface] Old SEPA module: pre_function behaviour in the 'Edit' link of the SEPA.Mandate form has been changed so filter query modification may be required in the Edit Mandate custom form.
      • CARDS-46546 [VISA interface] VISA Fee Prediction. Supported a new parameter, EXCLUDE_SIC.
      • CARDS-46549 [VISA interface] Visa/Affiliated Base II Outward: Fixed Special Chargeback Indicator to always fill it with space.

Now the INVOICE_POST_DUE global parameter is applied only if invoice status is changed during CDU and not on conversion of the transaction into an Instalment in the middle of the day.

      • CARDS-47313 [Issuing] Card production response loading for "PIN Reissuing" tasks has been fixed for chip cards without offline PIN validation feature
      • CARDS-47328 [VISA interface] VISA BASEII Inw History Processing: Fixed target_member_id filling when HISTORY_OUT_DOCS=Y.
      • CARDS-47339 [Reversal management] Account billing log records recalculated in the Storno process are now considered when creating a Full Payment event.
      • CARDS-47341 [Acquiring authorisation] Merchant name has been extended up to 83 characters for DCI channel. The same global parameter MERCHANT_NAME_LENGTH_X as for AMEX interface is used to define Merchant name length.
      • CARDS-47348 [Diners Club interface] Diners Club Acquiring filter has been changed to Diners Club. The components.ini file has been fixed.
      • CARDS-47351 [Acquiring] DCC Product: an action for deleting a DCC Sub contract has been added to the form. The following checks are performed: - zero balances and no turnover on contract accounts. - if balances are zero, but there was turnover, an expiration date is set for the contract to close it in the standard way on CDU.
      • CARDS-47352 [Issuing] Fixed procedure of unmarking card for production for Cards with applets without contract.
      • CARDS-47361 [NSPK interface] NSPK Inward: processing of file continues when "Wrong condition pairs" error occurs.
      • CARDS-47365 [SEPA interface] SEPA Export: Field "ReqdExctnDt" filling for credit transfer documents with the posting date
      • CARDS-47378 [UnionPay interface] CUP Outward Processing: Fixed filling TC100 'Amount, transaction' field to match its value with Authorization Field 4 when an Acquirer fee is present.
      • 1523223 [Core banking interface] [CARDS-46182] RBS. Payments Import : fixed "Invalid Renewal Batch Total" when the declined document has a partial amount.
      • C1507176475 [Case management] [CARDS-47305] Case amount calculation doesn't take into account non financial items under the case documents, such as Loyalty Points.
      • C1510157252 [Data preparation and card personalization] [CARDS-46414] Subdirectories scanning bug fixed in PM File Import pipe.
      • C1511248467 [Acquiring] [CARDS-46840] An issue with suspended acquiring BATCH_ID documents has been fixed. In some cases, they weren't sent to a merchant if an adjustment document had been processed.
      • I1503163430 [MasterCard interface] [CARDS-47115] IPM Inw History Processing: Fixed send_member_id and target_member_id for outward bank documents (HISTORY_OUT_DOCS=Y).
      • I1505059993 [MasterCard interface] [CARDS-46436] MC.Stop List Import: fixed clearing of "comment_text" field on record update.

      • I1508124180 [Dispute assistant] [CARDS-45550] History document posting: Amount processing.

      • I1509078666 [Automated routines] [CARDS-46229] The global parameter CLIENT_MOVE_FI_AFFILIATED now has a default value of "N". Clients will not be linked by default when related contracts are moved to another institution.
      • I1509182490 [AMEX interface] [CARDS-46423] AMEX GNS Inward Processing: Fixed filling PS_REF_NUMBER when Transaction Identifier (TID) starts with zeroes.
      • I1509248021 [Issuing authorisation] [CARDS-46375] Fixed incorrect processing of additional criteria for usage limiters (i.e. by document tags) when the limiter threshold was overridden for the contract.
      • I1510047135 [Case management] [CARDS-46222] Strategy approve process in Case Management configuration checks now that activities called from strategy and step rules are not defined both on the strategy and step level.
      • I1510063276 [Product management] [CARDS-46240] View RM_SUSP_RULE has been modified to avoid impact to delete package of services or contract
      • I1510156120 [Product management] [CARDS-46476] The "Pers. Orders" link and the ability to create a new order by a template have been added for corporate contracts.
      • I1510157789 [Application management] [CARDS-46499] Advanced Application R1 to create an individual standing order with a specific order code has been fixed: a new order is created if there is no order with this code. The global parameter APPL_ORDER_INDIVIDUAL should be set to 'R'.
      • I1510158133 [Authentication management] [CARDS-46367] Fixed unnecessary duplication of authentication scheme with DEMAND option when you try to close it

      • I1512073441 [Core banking interface] [CARDS-47135] Transaction Export: fixed "device cycle" filling
      • I1512105914 [Product inspector] [CARDS-47207] An issue with Trace mode setting when launching Test Script has been fixed. The Trace option should now work as follows: 1. Empty value: PI_TRACE_MODE global parameter is used. 2. No Trace: trace messages are not produced in Product Inspector Log Tree or in Process Messages. 3. Run with Trace: trace messages are produced both in Log Tree and in Process Messages.
      • I1512178596 [Product management] [CARDS-47230] The "Activate Order" step will now pass when a warning message is returned. Previously this caused a failure of order activation when an Event was required for the order to be active and the Event was not posted at the time.

The parameter TAGS_TC50_<Processing BIN> value must be agreed with OpenWay.

      • CARDS-46575 [NSPK interface] NSPK Inward: S2 message codes for dispute transactions are split by transaction types if possible.
      • CARDS-46592 [NSPK interface] Supported JCB in NSPK clearing interface.
      • CARDS-46805 [MasterCard interface] MPE Import: now not all MPE_IP00XXT1 tables are loaded from an MPE file but only those that are required for the following processing (MPE_IP0053T1, MPE_IP0057T1 are loaded only when MC_MPE_TARIFF=Y; MPE_IP0030T1, MPE_IP0059T1, MPE_IP0087T1, MPE_IP0095T1, MPE_IP0096T1 are loaded only when MC_MPE_IRD_CRITERIA=<Country1>,...<CountryN>, ; MPE_IP0052T1 is loaded only when MC_MPE_TARIFF=Y or MC_MPE_IRD_CRITERIA=<Country1>,...<CountryN>,).
      • CARDS-46856 [Diners Club interface] Supported Release 15.2 Addendum changes including the following: DCI Outwards Processing: Supported AQGEO filling; also fixed Charge Record - 06 fields TRMTYP, UTCTM and LCTIM. DCI Clearing Import: supported check for field AQGEO. DCI Inward Processing: supported new fields 38-47 for Charge Record 06.
      • CARDS-47130 [VISA interface] RA configuration and IC tariffs have been modified for Cyprus, Germany and Switzerland.
      • CARDS-47350 [NSPK interface] NSPK MPE: AMEX/CUP support added.
      • I1510211805 [MasterCard interface] [CARDS-46373] IRD configuration has been changed for Manual Cash Disbursement.

    UFX Core

    • 2.2.4-0010
      • UFX-242 [SOA] UFX Statement: "MergeCustomFees" mode has been amended to support merging of custom fee entries that don't have a main entry.
    • 2.2.4-0007
      • UFX-240 [Application management] XML Applications Response pipe now property exports details of error that occurred during application import. Wrong application status could previously be reported for application R1 when SHORT_DEFERRED_RESPONSE parameter was disabled.
    • 2.2.4-0006
      • UFX-237 [Tariff management] Tariff Data & Structure Import Pipe default behaviour has changed: it does not reject the incoming file on duplicate imports
      • I1510161245 [SOA] [UFX-238] WAY4CardsAdapter now uses AuthCode from UFX reversal request for matching with original request.
    • 2.2.4-0004
      • UFX-236 [Application management] Changed the default behaviour of the XML Advanced Applications Import (R2) pipe when the INPUT_FORMAT parameter is not specified. Now the pipe assumes UFX (FileHeader/FormatVersion='2.0') input format and immediately rejects all files that are not valid against UFX schema. For backward compatibility the pipe also supports legacy Application format (FileHeader/FormatVersion='1.0'), it can be enabled by setting the parameter INPUT_FORMAT=Application.
    • 2.2.4-0001
      • I1510076860 [SOA] [UFX-232] Restored support for the IS_CUSTOM_FEE column in custom ordering rules for UFX statements.
    • 2.2.4-0000
      • I1508112549 [SOA] [UFX-230] Fixed UFX schema: made AuthParameter/Value element optional.
    • 2.2.3-0008
      • UFX-211 [Application management] Now the UFX element StandOrder/ReasonDetails may only be present on export. If it's present in a UFX Application on import, the application will be declined.
    • 2.2.2-0012
      • UFX-216 [SOA] Billing addendum saved during billing payment operation now includes more operation details in field 111.
      • UFX-215 [Application management] Change to appl_standing_order table structure introduced in 03.42.30 is supported in application export. There is no change in export data format or contents.
    • 2.2.2-0007
      • UFX-213 [Application management] XML Applications Export pipes (R1 & R2) now make sure that order of sub-applications under each top-level application in the export file is the same as in the import file.
    • 2.2.2-0002
      • UFX-212 [Application management] Application_management\file_samples\readme.txt has been split into issuing and acquiring parts.
    • 2.2.1-0015
      • UFX-271 [Tariff management] Added support for THRESHOLD tariff role to tariff_domains_import/export and tariff_import/export pipes.
    • 2.2.1-0014
      • UFX-251 [Changes export] Changes Export pipe has been fixed: empty file is now created in proper subdirectory when CREATE_EMPTY_FILES=Y and LAYOUT_BY_FI=N.
    • 2.2.1-0012
      • UFX-240 [Application management] XML Applications Response pipe now property exports details of error that occurred during application import. Wrong application status could previously be reported for application R1 when SHORT_DEFERRED_RESPONSE parameter was disabled.
    • 2.2.1-0011
      • UFX-212 [Application management] Application_management\file_samples\readme.txt has been split into issuing and acquiring parts.
    • 2.2.1-0008
      • UFX-210 [SOA] Store-and-Forward can now be enabled for more UFX Doc message codes.
    • 2.2.1-0007
      • UFX-174 [Application management] BRANCH_ID_TYPE parameter of XML Applications Import R1 & R2 pipes can now be specified either as short code (B/N/C) or long code (Branch/Bank/CB). An invalid parameter value is now detected at pipe startup rather than when importing the first application.
    • 2.2.1-0003
      • UFX-208 [Application management] Now when exporting an application in UFX format, we produce the Contract/DeviceInfo element for acquiring applications only and the ProductionParms and PlasticInfo elements for issuing applications only.

    DB Kernel

    • 03.43.30.90
      • DBK-2785 [Configuration inspector] Corrected merging of MP_ETL_PARM table records using Configuration Inspector.
    • 03.43.30.89
      • DBK-2676 [Distributed processing] Fixed error: High Availability service was not active on this node just after activating.
      • DBK-2719 Fixed: HA support for SAF in TS.
    • 03.43.30.88
      • DBK-2624 [High availability] Use FORCE mode to set Online1 to available after upgrade in HA Switch.
    • 03.43.30.85
      • DBK-2604 [High availability] Fixed issue when a High-Availability service returned to an active state at the secondary node after the node became unavailable.
      • DBK-2650 [Configuration inspector] Import of merged data has been optimized. A record is updated in a single expression, not by one field at a time. For unchanged parent records, "Is Ready" status update is done once when loading subordinate records.
    • 03.43.30.83
      • DBK-2584 [Health monitoring] "Node availability" status supported.
      • DBK-2592 [High availability] Fixed incorrect HA services switching when WAY4R has a big latency.
    • 03.43.30.80
      • DBK-2550 [Health monitoring] Only processes that can be activated in the current node are monitored.
      • I1702039456 [Configuration inspector] [DBK-2558] Fixed error when collecting related data on FX Scheme export.
    • 03.43.30.77
      • DBK-2087 [DB manager] DB Manager form selects a reference value from long reference tables (long DDDW) using a LIKE SQL operator. It causes searching without index if the DB column is encrypted. To prevent such a case, declare the list of encrypted columns directly. The form will use '=' in the SQL statement for these columns. Use the ENCRYPTED_COLUMNS DB.INI parameter to declare the column list. Format of the parameter: <table code 1>.<column code 1>,<table code 2>.<column code 2>,...
      • DBK-2438 [Fast track upgrade] For LOCK/UNLOCK/KILL_SESSION actions, the optional procedure Sys.OWS_ADMINISTER_USER no longer checks that the user account being processed has system privileges. Otherwise, it would not be able to manage the HSK Owner user. These privileges continue to be checked for other actions with user accounts. Note that this is an insignificant reduction in security in the new version of the procedure.
    • 03.43.30.72
      • DBK-2429 [Configuration inspector] Fixed long value trimming on configuration export.
    • 03.43.30.68
      • DBK-2461 [Configuration inspector] Added the ability to transfer Sy. Configuration mapping for Datamart dimension tables.
    • 03.43.30.65
      • DBK-2424 [Configuration inspector] Fixed importing records with default column values. Buffered messages mode is used for the import process to preserve the import log in the case of a fatal exception.
      • I1612278687 [DB kernel] [DBK-2428] Non-periodic parallel process now processes Suspend and Resume correctly.
    • 03.43.30.62
      • DBK-2404 [High availability] Excluding some actions from outward replication did not work
    • 03.43.30.60
      • DBK-2379 [Distributed processing] Unable to set the primary unavailable with a console connected to a secondary if another secondaries exist
    • 03.43.30.52
      • DBK-2331 [DB kernel] Concurrence on updating process_log in Way4Replication has been fixed.
      • DBK-2342 [High availability] TS could not reject not-critical services without waiting for time-out if the only node was not available
      • I1611010227 [DB kernel] [DBK-2333] Fixed: SQL error in OpenWay\WAY4U\Business Processes\Business Processes -> Data form.
    • 03.43.30.50
      • DBK-2326 [High availability] Fixed latency of WAY4Replication copy process.
    • 03.43.30.41
      • DBK-2278 [DB kernel] Object Task Scheduler fails if the node is not available.
      • DBK-2280 [DB kernel] Fixed concurrency between object task and normal operations when the Object Task Scheduler is suspended.
      • DBK-2282 [DB kernel] A periodic process will no longer try to start working when it is suspended.
      • DBK-2283 [DB kernel] Fixed problem when process uniqueness control did not work if the process had the Suspended status.
      • DBK-2291 [High availability] High Concurrency on sw_service_activity when switching services to another node has been fixed.
    • 03.43.30.37
      • DBK-2258 [High availability] 'Retry All' in HA console utilised all available parrallel query servers
    • 03.43.30.32
      • DBK-2255 [High availability] Unable to switch easily between primary and secondary of the old version.
    • 03.43.30.29
      • DBK-2238 [DB kernel] Now for any error, the SQL Exporter pipe saves error details to the process log and displays a message to the user.
      • I1609232726 [DB manager] [DBK-2247] Report Engine R2 batch mode. The engine incorrectly substituted SELECT columns into parameters if the substitutions were marked by sequence numbers (%1%, %2%, ...).
    • 03.43.30.21
      • DBK-2203 [DB kernel] The default value for line separator has been changed from LF to CRLF. The LINE_SEPARATOR parameter has been added and it configures the Java SQL Exporter Pipe.
    • 03.43.30.16
      • DBK-2208 [Scheduler] Reports Engine R2 (batch mode) didn't fill P_CONNID parameter if it was launched from Scheduler.
    • 03.43.30.10
      • DBK-2201 [WAY4 Web] Now audit log is active by default. To exclude set AUDIT_MODE='N' To include for particular group set AUDIT_MODE for this group
    • 03.43.30.09
      • DBK-2180 [High availability] Fixed service migration (switching Main and Reserve nodes). After migration, a service becomes Inactive on the old Main node and Active on the new Main node.
    • 03.43.30.04
      • DBK-2162 [DB manager] Reports Engine R2 processed double symbols '%' in parameter value incorrectly. Replace %% with %%%%.
      • DBK-2176 [Distributed processing] To avoid a large number of queries to gv$instance from multithread periodic jobs, set the process parameter EXIT_ON_MAX_DELAY = 'N'.
    • 03.43.30.02
      • DBK-2139 [DB manager] Reports Engine R2. New parameters for Batch report utility: errorStatusXml (to switch off corresponding Report Server parameter), errorDir (directory for error reports).
    • 03.43.29.48
      • DBK-2143 [DB manager] Report Engine R2 generated an exception if it was requested to save result file on server.
      • DBK-2147 [DB kernel] Telescope was unable to run reports with report server version 11+ if a parameter contained a single quote character.
    • 03.43.29.46
      • DBK-2139 [DB manager] Reports Engine R2. New parameters for Batch report utility: errorStatusXml (to switch off corresponding Report Server parameter), errorDir (directory for error reports).
    • 03.43.29.27
      • DBK-2107 [DB manager] Report Engine R2. Parameters P_USER, P_TITLE can be set in menu item parameter list.
      • DBK-2109 [DB kernel] The CopyOfficers script now locks a user account if Officer.is_active is not "Yes".
      • I1606063687 [DB manager] [DBK-2100] Reports Engine R2 no longer ignores the report_server_http_timeout parameter.
    • 03.43.29.17
      • DBK-2075 [DB manager] Pipe name has been added to PROCESS_LOG.PARAMETERS as the tag PIPE=pipe_name; This relates to pipes stored in client\shared\pipes directory.
    • 03.43.29.16
      • DBK-2062 W4W writes logs into SY_AUDIT_LOG table instead of BP_OFF_OP_LOG table
    • 03.43.29.14
      • DBK-2029 [High availability] Way4R copy: slow performance when there are a lot of uncopied changes with default parameters.
      • DBK-2030 [Distributed processing] Migrating HA services did not always switch service activity.
      • DBK-2048 [DB kernel] Audit log records did not contain the user name if the application session used an oracle user was not registerered as an officer
      • I1604262805 [Scheduler] [DBK-2047] Scheduler R2 couldn't execute batch reports using Reports Engine R2. TNS name wasn't transfered to Oracle Report Server.
    • 03.43.29.13
      • I1605067765 [DB manager] [DBK-2031] To switch encoding in the "Save As" dialog of "SQL Executor" use the new db.ini parameter "SQL_EXEC_SAVEAS_ENCODING" with the values ANSI, UTF8.
    • 03.43.29.12
      • DBK-1960 [DB kernel] Oracle LOB column encryption is supported in Online Table Migration Tool (RedefineWiz.bat). See documentation for details (manuals/system/ows_OnlineTableMigration.html).
      • DBK-2019 [DB kernel] New columns sy_conf_group_val.add_num (Additional Numeric Value) and sy_conf_group_val.sort_order for report configuration have been added.
      • DBK-2022 [DB kernel] Fixed issue when process uniqueness control did not work if the process had the Suspended status.
      • DBK-2026 [Housekeeping] HSK multithread execute failed on HSK.EXPIRED.SAVE.APPL_ACNT
      • I1604050612 [DB kernel] [DBK-2024] 'Officer with id= does not exist' when auto creating new users

      • DBK-2048 [DB kernel] Audit log records did not contain the user name if the application session used an oracle user was not registerered as an officer

    • 03.43.19.13
      • DBK-1940 [High availability] Way4R Copy can use several connections for reading si_log_src.
      • DBK-1982 [High availability] Way4R did not copy changes until the source session is closed if a session had been idle for more than one minute
      • DBK-1984 [High availability] Way4 Replication: wrong latency calculation for Way4 Replication Copy Fixed

      • DBK-1970 [Scheduler] ORA-06502 on attaching to a process with a lot of parameters
    • 03.43.19.11
      • DBK-1957 [Housekeeping] Disabling a HSK rule for a particular node did not take effect
    • 03.43.19.10
      • DBK-1942 [High availability] Running Way4R with parameter TRACE=Y enables sql trace in the source (db link) session in addition to the target one
      • DBK-1926 [DB manager] Pipe exe executor.dll has been added to Full filter.
      • DBK-1943 [Scheduler] Included the directories HOME\install\way4manager and HOME\client\way4manager\components in the "WAY4 Scheduler" filter.

      • DBK-1970 [Scheduler] ORA-06502 on attaching to a process with a lot of parameters

      • DBK-1957 [Housekeeping] Disabling a HSK rule for a particular node did not take effect

      • DBK-1895 [High availability] WAY4R copied data before the flow start point.
    • 03.43.09.10
      • DBK-1859 [DB manager] Fixed bug. DBM no longer deletes files from C:\.

      • DBK-1874 [High availability] Way4R could loss some changes made in the short oracle session

    • 03.42.99.16
      • DBK-1895 [High availability] WAY4R copied data before the flow start point.
    • 03.42.99.14
      • DBK-1859 [DB manager] Fixed bug. DBM no longer deletes files from C:\.
      • DBK-1871 [High availability] Way4R crashed while replicating delete operation if this operation raised an exception
      • DBK-1874 [High availability] Way4R could loss some changes made in the short oracle session
    • 03.42.99.13
      • I1601157925 [High availability] [DBK-1855] Database changes are not prohibited in an unavailable node.
    • 03.42.99.12
      • DBK-1850 [DB kernel] WAY4R synchronisation conflicts on num_seq_range in active-active mode.
    • 03.42.99.11
      • DBK-1833 [DB manager] Product Inspector tree control has been enhanced.
      • DBK-1840 [Housekeeping] Housekeeping could not run in a secondary node with parallel threads.
    • 03.42.99.10
      • DBK-1758 [Datamart] Datamart Upgrade Wizard has been enhanced. The "Attach Datamart" action has been removed. The action is only available in the DM console.
      • DBK-1787 [Configuration inspector] The ability to import a configuration to a different version has been enhanced. If not all fields from the source scheme are present in the target scheme, records can now be added in the Copy Configuration Import Screen "Exc: Fld Types" screen form. The "Table Code" and "Field Code" fields must be filled in manually (for each removed field) and "Removed" must be selected in the drop-down list of the "Field Type" field.
      • DBK-1797 [Housekeeping] Housekeeping created a large number of extra sections for si_log_src and si_log_dst at the end of the year.
      • DBK-1818 [High availability] Fixed the issue when a large number of failed changes was caused by foreign key constraint errors on applying a high volume of changes after a long gap.
      • DBK-1830 [High availability] WAY4R: "Retry for all" is not efficient if there is a large number of waiting changes.
